name: SunsplashedSerenity walk to Harvard & Fresh Pond
description:
An elegant, sun-splashed, 2 bedroom (+2offices) apartment with parking, a 15-minute walk or 7-minute bike ride to Harvard (bikes provided). Enjoy this spacious 1st floor unit in a stylish 3-level house, with its gorgeous yard and two bluestone patios, on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village Cambridge. Sleeps 5.

The space
An elegant, sun-splashed, 2+ bedroom apartment, just a 15-minute walk (or 7-minute bike ride, bikes provided!) to Harvard. Enjoy the spacious 1st floor of a 3-level house on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village, (West) Cambridge. Sleeps 5. Bedroom 1: queen bed; Bedroom 2: twin bed; Study: pull-out double sofa bed.

Recently renovated with designer furnishings and attention to detail. Breakfast at the kitchen bay window overlooking the garden. Enjoy the contemporary bath, full dining room, living room with French doors to a study with "instant" office (wi-fi & printer/scanner/copier provided). European cable lighting, hardwood fl
neighborhood_overview:
Huron Village is known for its charm. We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square. Not to mention the scrumptious take-out, available in several local places. (URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live on the second floor at 64 Granville Road with my daughter.  We enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: Lovely Studio Room: Available for long w/ends
description:
Large sunny room w kitchenette & bath. Foam mat can be added for 3rd person. Must love rescue dogs; Callie is a gem; likes pets when you come and go. Quality queen mattress, fridge, microwave, good wifi, en-suite marble bath. Quiet, leafy Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life. Walk, bike or bus to Harvard, Tufts, MIT, Lesley . **Must like kids, adorable ones live above & you will hear their footsteps at times. Covid Vaccination. No lock on room. No use of rest of house currently

The space
We have a peaceful, large, sunny room w/ attached marble bath, good water pressure, a fridge/microwave/toaster oven, high speed wifi. We're on a quiet, tree-lined street in a wonderful part of Cambridge, moments walk to Davis, Alewife, close to Porter Squares. The room comfortably fits a couple with one child on good foam mat on floor. (We also have a couple of other rooms which may be available when the studio is full ). Here's what else you get: self-serve coffee/tea,
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and our street is tree-lined, and known as one of the nicest blocks in what is a great neighborhood. It's far enough away from the main street so you won't hear any noise, yet within moments you can be at the subway or in Davis or Porter Squares. there's a sweet playground nearby, a bike trail extending 19 miles, and many parks. A Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within a 15 minute walk.
host_about:
Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well for a native NY'er (I've been here since graduate school which was over 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

A few notes & rules to help you decide if this is a good landing spot!
1) Bedroom doors do not have a locks on them
2) Best if you feel relaxed and affectionate with rescue dogs: (She won't be here if you rent the entire condo)
3) Please keep tidy; throw out your trash and recycling—at least every other day
4) Condo kitchen: Available for use only if you rent the entire condo; studio room has a kitchenette but the other airbnb rooms do not
5)  Please strip bed and open windows at check out
6) Cannot store luggage pre-arrival or post check -out
7) No smoking anything/anywhere on the property or outside on the court: Rule is enforced as per the request of our neighbors. 
8) Please be vaccinated against covid and updated with booster for variants of the virus for your own and our protection; thank you ! 

My son (now a young man) is also helpful with guests. My new dog, Callie,  is one of the sweetest mutts ever...She's a rescue and still a puppy so it's best if you like and understand dogs. She will not be here if you are renting the entire condo, of course :) She's a gem and needs a little petting initially in order to settle down around new guests! She will definitely bark a tiny bit when you come & go. Small children live upstairs so at times you will hear them running around; they are adorable and sweet!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS of "gobus" leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house at Alewife in Cambridge.

name: Cambridge Getaway @ Harvard & MIT
description:
Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the third floor of our beautiful Victorian home.

The space
This is a charming furnished 2 bedroom apartment with a full bathroom, large eat in kitchen, and a living room. It is on the top floor of a well kept Victorian home. It has a small roof deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening. The apartment is located within walking distance of MIT and Harvard. Central and Inman Square are less than 5 minutes away. You can walk to fine dining in Inman square where you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants. Downtown Boston is only a 10 minute train ride away. There you will find shopping areas, world-class hospitals, the convention center, and various museums. Our location is truly in Mid-Cambridge. There is a Whole Foods market and a number of cafes just down the street. Rates are subject to change during the busy season Boston Marathon, local graduations, reunions and the Regatta. The apartment is
neighborhood_overview: Annmarie and I have lived in this area for over 50 years. We both live on the first floor of this house and know where people want to go. We can suggest the best restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood.
host_about: Annmarie and I were both born here in Cambridge. We have lived in the same location our entire lives. It is a wonderful area for visiting the city..We started with Airbnb for 4 years now and it has been a wonderfull experience. Many people have stayed here from all over the world.. Marathons, Graduations, Reunions and Family get togethers. We are surrounded by Great restaurant's and cafe's.. We are 5 minutes to bus lines and the Redline. You can walk to Harvard or MIT in 10-15 minutes Walkability has a 95% rating. We also have free parking.

name: "The Treehouse" :   Elegant living near Harvard
description:
An elegant, contemporary, top-floor unit in the quiet, green, Huron Village area of Cambridge, with its boutiques, restaurants, galleries, grocer, antique shop, & a used bookstore. Walk to Harvard & Porter Squares, the Charles River, & Fresh Pond. Ride along the Minuteman Bike Path. Enjoy our large backyard with its 2 patios, double hammock, lounge chairs, & croquet lawn (and wi-fi). Close to Route 2. From 5/15-8/31 short-term guests. Starting 9/1 long-term guests only (3 months or more).

The space
This stylish, contemporary, architect-designed, skylit, tree-top, compact (~700 sq. ft.) apartment can sleep 4: 2 in queen bed + 2 on fold-out floor mattresses in either the 2nd bedroom (which is set up as an office) or the living room alcove. Enjoy the lovely shady patio (with wi-fi), lounge in the quiet backyard in the double hammock. Stroll to Fresh Pond & Harvard Square in quiet, leafy Huron Village after breakfast at Hi-Rise Bakery. A perfect Cambridge ex

name: Apartment in Harvard's Backyard
description:
The space
Gorgeous apartment in the ideal Cambridge location! It's a spacious and well-laid out one-bedroom - perfect for a couple. It has a nice size living room with incredible sunlight. It's in the tallest building on our street, so from the couch, we see treetops out of all four living room windows! The bedroom has a Queen-size bed, an enormous closet, AC, and 2 windows. Even the bathroom gets sunlight so bright that you feel like you're showering outside! The kitchen is awesome - marble countertops, dishwasher, etc. There are also hardwood floors throughout (minus kitchen and bathroom). There's laundry and bike storage in the basement and a shared yard to boot!

Because we often get asked: we have a Queen-size bed in the bedroom, which is perfect for a couple. When one bed is not enough, we host guests in the living room on our very comfortable West Elm couch, and on our top-of-the-line full size air mattress.

We're smack between Harvard and Ce
host_about: We are professionals living in Cambridge, MA.  Nicole is from New (Website hidden by Airbnb) is from Haifa.  We love travelling and we've stayed in airbnbs all over the world!

name: East Cambridge Apartment
description:
Our four bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge. Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines. Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.

The space
Location, location, location! It is conveniently located a mile from Harvard Square, steps away from MIT, and a ten minute walk to Charles River and multiple T stops to travel to Boston. This is an 1854 home that has been entirely renovated on the first floor and basement level. Apartment has driveway, a backyard, an updated kitchen, 1 king bed in one bedroom, 2 twins in the bedroom and a bunk bed in the third (2 twins) and a single in the fourth. The apartment is located in Kendall Square and a short walk to many bars and restaurants. Apartment has high ceilings, washer/dryer in kitchen, flat screen tv, and feels far bigger than 2200 sq. feet.

Guest access
No keys involved, you will receive
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is tucked away behind MIT and Kendall Square.  East Cambridge still has a strong Portuguese population that is apparent with grape vines surrounding our yard.  Our oldest son goes to school down the street and we love the community and our neighborhood.
host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of airbnb and the idea of communal living.  As a young family we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and yard.

name: Elegant Airy Comfort. Workspace. Private Entrance.
description:
Wonderfully located, spacious & immaculate, the apartment is the second floor of an 1890's two-family home with high ceilings and big windows. There are two bedrooms, a separate study with a desk and bed, two bathrooms, and a third bedroom available (at an additional charge.)
The amazing neighborhood offers great restaurants, markets and shops --there's something interesting for everyone to do. You don't need a car since the subway entrance is nearby, but one driveway parking space is included.

The space
I am an Interior Designer; I emphasize comfort, convenience, beauty, and good art. We've attended to the details that will make your stay supremely pleasurable. The sheets are ironed, there are toys and supplies for children, the toiletries are lovely, the towels are large, and the Welcome Basket is stocked with deliciousness. This is a great place for a family or a small group of friends!

The Location
You can be on the Boston Common and Fr
neighborhood_overview:
Please remember that the AirBnB "pins" do not show you exact listing locations. We are a three-four minute walk to Davis Square and the subway in one direction, and also a two-three minute walk to the grocery store and bus on Mass Ave in the other direction.
Our location offers very easy access to Harvard, Tufts, Cambridge, Arlington and Boston. There are children's playgrounds within a short walk, and a public beach within a short drive. Davis Square, right at the next corner, is a destination in itself.
Here's a portion of an article from the Boston Globe about Davis Square:

Somerville crossroads lives up to its hip image

“We’ve come from a foreign land called suburbia,” a mother joked to her two highly energized toddlers as they darted about on the busy sidewalks of Davis Square. On a sunny Saturday afternoon, urban bohemians and families alike swarmed into this hipster beehive to purge their cabin fever.

Sandwiched between Tufts Universit
host_about:
Richard is an artist. I worked as a residential designer/builder for years, and now I write about it. I also consult with non-profit organizations about strategic planning,
We love to travel as well, and also have a home on Prince Edward Island in Canada.  Where-ever we go, I like to cook and dance.

name: Quiet, Artistically Decorated Cambridge Apartment
description:
The space
Starting at $200 a Night for up to four Guests

Our quiet apartment is located on one of the more beautiful tree lined residential streets in No. Cambridge. It’s a 1/3 mile walk to both the Davis Square and Alewife T Stations and two blocks from the bus into Harvard Square, allowing easy access to Cambridge and Boston.
- Totally renovated in 2011.
-In bedroom there is a queen sized bed.
-Livingroom has an American Leather (www.americanleather.com) sleeper sofa with a Tempur-Pedic Gel queen size mattress. Hands down the most comfortable sleeper sofa on the market! There is a light blocking curtain separating the living room and kitchen for privacy if sleeping in the living room.
- Very large kitchen equipped with a gas stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, hot water kettle, plates, glasses, utensils, pots, and pans. Tea, coffee and other treats are provided. Large refrigerator/freezer can be plugge
neighborhood_overview: Our street is a beautiful quiet tree lined street that does not get a lot of car traffic since it is not a through street from major roads.  There are several parks close by- a large one that is great for jogging, soccer, softball, track and smaller ones that with newly renovated playground equipment and water features for hot days.
host_about: I have lived in this house for almost 30 years and have renovated almost every square inch of it.  I have two daughters who have graduated college (Colorado College & Princeton) and a son who graduated from Harvard College in 2022.  I love cycling, rowing, walks, yoga, cooking, and hanging out with family and friends.

name: See Yourself in Central Square
description:
The space
Welcome to our Central Square Apartment, right in the heart of downtown Cambridge! Steps away from the Red Line, we are located right in between Harvard and MIT!

Our Second Floor walk up is a studio apartment with King sized bed, full sized futon couch and sun filled atrium complete with hammock. It has a full bath and a well stocked kitchen. A former seamstress's shop in the seventies, it has floor to ceiling mirrors that gives the space an even larger feel. It still retains some of that funky seventies charm.

Though right in the heart of downtown Cambridge, the apartment is set back from the street so it is surprisingly quiet. An oasis from the city sounds, the apartment shares the 4 story building with office space so evenings are very quiet and private. The Green Street parking garage is located across the street and charges $13 a day. Pearl Street laundromat is two blocks away.

Central Square is the hub of Cambridge. Ri
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

★★★★★★★★

name: Home on quiet street near Harvard
description:
Bedroom with double bed, desk, closet, wi-fi, and two windows. Bathroom for guest(s) only. Kitchen has breakfast supplies and storage space for guest(s) but also used by owner and occasionally family members.
Minimum of three nights booking reservations.

The space
Second-floor room adjacent to bathroom and kitchen shared with owner.
Walk up one flight from porch.
Fifteen-minute walk to Harvard Square.
Ten-minute walk to Harvard Yard.
Five-minute walk to Harvard Law School.

Room contains double bed, closet, desk, Wireless access, and basic TV.
Linens provided ( sheets, bath towels, hand towels, etc.)
In cold weather, guests have access to the thermostat and also small plug-in heater/fan.
Room has AC installed in window during summer.
Movable fans for other rooms.
Simple breakfast supplies available in kitchen (coffee/tea, milk, juice, cereal, bagels, fruit, eggs).


Laundromat and cafe
host_about:
I have lived in my house in Cambridge for more than forty years, during which I have shared the space with family and first-floor tenants. Though my children are grown, I love my neighborhood and appreciate the sense of community.  I know well the advantages of this location, and I always enjoy connecting people with historic and cultural resources. In keeping with these enthusiasms, I volunteer as a guide at deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln and participate in projects at a community art center near my house.  I post about art in the Boston area on a blog called ART OUTDOORS. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Currently a freelance writer and editor of educational materials, I keep a home office but still have one guest room that is not used often enough.  I think the room would prove to be a comfortable base for someone attending a conference or exploring the Boston area. 
I am vaccinated and boosted and try to follow whatever masking, testing, and cleaning guidelines are current.

name: School Term Housing in Mid Cambridge MA!
description:
- Enjoy the comfort & convenience of my cozy 1 bedroom, on a quiet street in Mid Cambridge. With lots of light, hardwood floors, french doors, a beautiful kitchen & 2 decks. Minutes to Harvard, MIT & public transportation.

The space
Fully furnished, lots of windows and hardwood floors throughout, lovely front and back porches, landscaped garden & patio. 700 sq. ft. includes living room with study area & pull out sofa bed, bedroom with queen sized bed, window air conditioners, large closets and bathroom with tub. Large eat-in kitchen is fully equipped with brand new stainless steel appliances, microwave, dishwasher, disposal.

Guest access
Fee includes all utilities, internet/cable & laundry included. Street parking with Permit. Short term visitors parking permit provided only.

Other things to note
This property is available for the full school year or summer sessions.
neighborhood_overview: Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy excellent dining, entertainment, site seeing & seasonal events. Everything you need is near by including grocery stores, library, post office, drug stores, cafes, banks, hubway bikes, Charles River.
host_about: Hi, I am Melissa. I grew up in historic Lexington Mass and studied Art History and Art Education. I make sculpture out of recycled computer parts out of a Maker Space called the Artisan's Asylum in Somerville and teach people of all ages. I put my heart and soul into renovating my condo and turned it into the dream home I always wanted! I love the back porch and back yard. It is the most relaxing place to hang out on a hot summer day! I rent to Harvard and MIT affiliates. Many international scholars have stayed in my condo.  Come visit MA. I live around the block and would be happy to give suggestions of what to see and do on your visit!

description:
4 bedrooms, 2 full baths! Safe, comfortable, bright, happy architecturally designed. fun Cambridge neighborhood. Walk to trains, bus, Harvard/Davis/Porter. Comfortably fits 7 people for family sabbatical or holiday. 4 bedrooms, (2 queens, one full, one single—all very high end comfortable mattresses/organic). Leafy, quiet neighborhood near cool city spots; walk, bike or bus to Harvard! **Pls note: Must like children; pitter-patter of v sweet 2 & 5 yr-olds running above us for short spurts!

The space
beautiful, sunny, well-maintained; please leave it as you find it. thx!

Guest access
All rooms including: 2 bathrooms, 3 bedrooms ( 2 w queen-sized beds), and living room and kitchen. One room w full bed downstairs.

C0169140491
neighborhood_overview: great neighborhood, again deets will be found in other listing
host_about:
Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well for a native NY'er (I've been here since graduate school which was over 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

A few notes & rules to help you decide if this is a good landing spot!
1) Bedroom doors do not have a locks on them
2) Best if you feel relaxed and affectionate with rescue dogs: (She won't be here if you rent the entire condo)
3) Please keep tidy; throw out your trash and recycling—at least every other day
4) Condo kitchen: Available for use only if you rent the entire condo; studio room has a kitchenette but the other airbnb rooms do not
5)  Please strip bed and open windows at check out
6) Cannot store luggage pre-arrival or post check -out
7) No smoking anything/anywhere on the property or outside on the court: Rule is enforced as per the request of our neighbors. 
8) Please be vaccinated against covid and updated with booster for variants of the virus for your own and our protection; thank you ! 

My son (now a young man) is also helpful with guests. My new dog, Callie,  is one of the sweetest mutts ever...She's a rescue and still a puppy so it's best if you like and understand dogs. She will not be here if you are renting the entire condo, of course :) She's a gem and needs a little petting initially in order to settle down around new guests! She will definitely bark a tiny bit when you come & go. Small children live upstairs so at times you will hear them running around; they are adorable and sweet!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS of "gobus" leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house at Alewife in Cambridge.

description:
First floor apartment located in our 2 family home. Located in vibrant and hip Inman Square. 5 minute walk to the New Union Square Green Line T stop.

I live in a separate apartment upstairs with my husband and 2 children.

City of Cambridge Inspected and Licensed as a LEGAL short term rental apartment.

Registration No. STR-14611 with the City of Cambridge,MA

The space
2 bedroom Apartment on the first floor of our 2 family home. Centrally located in vibrant Inman Square. 15 minute walking distance to Harvard Sq, 5 minute walk to the new Union Square T Green Line T stop,,10 min walk to Central Square and the Red Line T. If you have a car we can provide 1 visitors pass for short term on street parking in the area ( please let me know ahead of time if you will be needing it).. This is a perfect location for visiting Harvard University, MIT or Boston.. 26 fabulous restaurants, cafes and coffee shops just around the corner or use th
neighborhood_overview: What is not to love about Inman Square!! Tons of Restaurants and still maintaining a neighborhood feel. There are 2 WholeFoods Markets within a 10 minute walk.

I am married and a mom to two amazing children and an Airbnb host since 2012. I was the Chef/Owner of two award winning restaurants in Boston prior to having children. My husband Chad is a Communications Consultant. 

 Cambridge has been our home for almost 20 years and is an amazing place to live and raise a family.

name: Quiet private room in N. Cambridge
description:
Quiet room w/ futon and couch, desk, and closet.

Bus to Harvard Square leaves just around the corner. It's about a 10 to 14 minute ride depending on the time of day, and there is a subway connection there.
There is also a subway stop about a 13 minute walk from my place.

I have a lot of hosting experience and can provide good tips depending on an individual's interests.

I DO require guests to let me know of their vaccination and booster status for COVID 19 and to send proof before arrival.

Futon is comfortable, and there is a couch that can be slept on as well. There are hangers in closet to hang up some clothes. Bathroom, which the host uses as well, is just outside room in hallway.

Assess to kitchen and dining room as well as front balcony and back porch.

Please check with me about check-in times as they can vary from day to day. I never rush guests out in the mornin
neighborhood_overview: This was the working class neighborhood of Cambridge, the area where former speaker of the house, Tip O'Neil, grew up. A lot of condos have gone up in the neighborhood. It's an area that borders Arlington and Somerville, and Belmont and Watertown are also very close.
host_about: Worked in music industry for over 20 years. Passionate about music including music from many different areas of the world. I'm also an avid biker. I've traveled extensively on a budget and am very resourceful helping others who may have a limited budget find things to do that they can afford.

name: Minutes to Harvard Square
description:
This is a newly-updated well-maintained 2 bedroom condo unit in a classic Cambridgian triple decker house setting. We are located on the first floor (or 'ground floor' in European terms). There is a separate front entrance to our unit. The condo is located in Strawberry Hill, the quietest and safest residential neighborhood in Cambridge, 1.5 miles west of Harvard Square. Away from subway metro stops but accessible to the station with four frequent bus lines. Great amenities by foot.

The space
The prestine unit is located within 8 minutes of bus ride to Harvard Square (4 different MBTA buses; with Apps to track live bus location). Free street parking just in front of the condo, which is rare for Cambridge. No issue finding parking on the street. The larger master bedroom has a queen size bed, two large closets, window AC, additional electric heating unit and bureau. The other smaller bedroom has a full size sofa bed, two closets and writing area. The living ro
neighborhood_overview: very quiet and family oriented. Free street parking directly in front of the house. Walkable to public library, playgrounds, supermarkets, restaurants and outdoor tennis/golf/running trails. Car rental within 1 mile.
host_about: I live between two coasts. I love to travel, and I'm quite easy going.  I've spent my formative years in various continents, experienced to various cultures.

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Harvard/Kendall/Central-1BR
description:
Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Very convenient to MGH. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Convenient for functions at MIT or Harvard. Located in Central Square, we are an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.

The space
First off, in these days of divisiveness, we should make clear that everyone is welcome here. Period. If you have medical needs at MGH, our house can be a safe, quiet respite. This rental is effectively a studio apartment with a private, locked entrance on the middle floor in a 3-unit building. It consists of a private bedroom, private eat-in kitchen and full bathroom in Central Square. In nice weather, guests love to hangout on the private back porch surrounded by matur
neighborhood_overview:
Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. Generally speaking, this side of the river is dramatically calmer than the Boston side though now bustling with a nice variety of great restaurants.

We actively recycle. There is a blue bin in the unit. Or, we can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

name: Huron Village Lower Unit Harvard Sq
description:
Beautifully decorated apartment in the heart of Huron Village - less than a mile away from Harvard Square. Colorful and light-filled open floor plan with two bedrooms & one bath. This is the lower unit in a two-unit home. Please note we rarely accept short term (under two-weeks) stays more than 2 months in advance.

The space
Our Philly-Style apartment is available for short or medium-term rentals. Perfect for visiting professors and parents visiting their children at Harvard or any of the other area colleges or universities. Also great for business travelers who want a more spacious workspace than a cramped suite at a nearby hotel may give them or small families or groups of friends who are tourists in Cambridge/Boston area. There are two bedrooms - one on each floor and one bath. Beautifully decorated with family antiques and new modern furniture. Lots of original and unique art is hung across the walls. Marimekko (which is across the street) fabrics and pill
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the greatest neighborhood in Cambridge (okay - we're bias). Conveniently located between Harvard Square and Fresh Pond our home is at the center of it all. The house sits at the intersection of Mobilia Gallery, Marimekko, and the Cambridge Trust Bank. The Fresh Pond Market is just across the street for all your grocery needs including beer and wine. If you don't feel like cooking then cross the street to Full Moon a European-American bistro or the Village Kitchen which has great pizza and italian fare. Just up the street is Formaggio's Kitchen a gourmand's paradise offer the best cheese selection in the world!  There are a dozen more funky independent shops around for clothing, furniture, books and more. Huron Village is bustling by day and quiet at night. Currently there is some construction going on the street/neighborhood which may start around 7 am  and can be a bit noisy some weekdays.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

name: Long term only, Modern Entire Condo MIT/MGH $3600
description:
Entire Condo for long term rental with 2 bed, a sun-filled study, open layout modern kitchen & cozy living with fireplace close to MIT, Kendall, and MGH. Central H/A (unlike most in area) means no radiators and true AC! *We love to help families traveling for medical treatment.*

The space
We are looking for a long-term rental. Please contact us for details. This listing is for the *entire* apartment including all bills, gas, utilities, satellite tv, internet, plus all essentials and hospitality products you might need!

The condo is modern, which means we have central heat and air conditioning (unlike most apartments in Cambridge--crucial in the summer months, and nice instead of radiators in the winter months), a dishwasher, garbage disposal, convection oven, huge new hot water heater, modern refrigerator with filtered water and ice dispenser, a working gas fireplace, and an open kitchen and living room with lots of counter space.

The hous
neighborhood_overview: We're in the awesome area of Cambridge, near up-n-coming Kendall. Very close to MIT (5 min walk), the redline T (12 min walk), and buses that take you directly to the T stop just a block over (2 min walk). Also just a block or two to some of the best pubs and restaurants in the Boston area!!! Lord Hobo (voted best beer in Boston), Tatte (a celebrated pastry bakery and coffee), Emma's Pizza, Cambridge Brewing Company (voted best brew pub in America), Dunkin Donuts (New England tradition), and Friendly Toast (best breakfast/brunch in Boston) are all within just a block or so! At the same time we are in a very quiet, nice, and safe neighborhood with peaceful outdoor areas.
host_about: Love art, music, nature, animals, nuclear energy, and conservation.

name: Renovated Brownstone - MIT/Kendall Square
description:
Cozy private room and bath in a renovated brownstone in East Cambridge. GREAT LOCATION! Near MIT, MGH, Charles River with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer.

For our safety and that of our guests, we can only accept requests from fully COVID vaccinated guests. Please confirm this when booking. Also, please provide us with some information about the purpose of trip and your travel plans. This helps us better meet your needs. Thanks in advance!

The space
ACCOMMODATIONS:
Your private bedroom is up one flight of stairs and features:
- Super comfortable Queen-Size bed, bureau and closet
- Private bathroom with towels and toiletries
- Other amenities: hair dryer, iron and ironing board and Wi-Fi
- Access to a lovely living room with cable TV

In the summer, guests can enjoy a self-serve, continental style breakfast in the private patio and year round in our large modern kitchen.
Unf
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

If you are going to visit Boston and Cambridge, this is the place to stay. I am located in East Cambridge - near Kendall Square, MIT, Harvard, Massachusetts General Hospital, and Boston - with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer. The Museum of Science, the Galeria Mall, and the Charles River are a short 3-5 block walk and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.
host_about:
I have been hosting with Airbnb in my home since 2013 and am delighted to be back in business after our year of a COVID hiatus. Having received my second COVID vaccine, I am beginning to see a light at the end of this tunnel. I hope you are doing well and ready to travel again. New England is a great place to visit so I look forward to meeting you soon!

A little bit about me…
Originally from Florida, I found my way to New England via Spain where I lived and worked for 10 years! I have resided in Cambridge for the past 16 years and love everything it has to offer. I know the city well and can give you tips on things to do, places to see, and where to eat! 

My partner, Steve, and I are both retired from the education field. I was a Spanish teacher and he retired as a library director. We love to travel, cook, and spend time with friends and family.  

Hope you will plan to visit, we would love to host you.

name: 2 Cozy Rooms Near Harvard Square
description:
COVID IN FORMATION: IN ADDITION TO STRICT CLEANING PROTOCOLS WE ARE A FULLY VACCINATED HOUSEHOLD. WE WILL NOT BE IN RESIDENCE (except for a few random days), JUNE THROUGH SEPTEMBER WHICH MEANS YOU WILL HAVE OUR WHOLE FIRST FLOOR TO YOURSELVES.

Our lovely and spacious Victorian home is located on a quiet one way street between Harvard and Inman Squares. A fifteen minute walk will bring you to historic Harvard Square where the subway can transport you to downtown Boston in under 10 minutes.

The space
The First floor of our home includes a fully equipped eat in kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 1 and 1/2 baths, a living and dining room and piano room. Vibrant Inman Square is a 5 minute walk with a large selection of fabulous restaurants for all budgets. I'm a foodie so ask me for recommendations! Free off street parking is usually available or a street parking permit.

A perfect location for visiting the many colleges in the area including Harvard, MIT,
neighborhood_overview: Proximity to Harvard (0.8 miles) and Inman Squares, great restaurants within walking distance, interesting architecture.
host_about:
I am a retired pediatric nurse practitioner married to a cabinetmaker who loves to travel (especially to Italy)! I love meeting new people from around the world and helping them to fully experience my wonderful home town of Cambridge/Boston. I am a foodie and can steer you to fabulous restaurants (many of them walking distance from my home).
My kids are grown so I now have 2 comfortable, peaceful rooms available to guests.
Looking forward to meeting you!

name: Serene & cozy 1BR oasis, walk to  Harvard Square!
description:
Tastefully decorated apartment on tree-lined street just outside Inman Square in Cambridge.
Located conveniently near the Cambridge Public Library, Harvard, MIT and many restaurants/cafes.
15 minute walk to Harvard and Central Square (redline).

The space
Beautifully renovated, modern, cozy oasis in the city. This little apartment is a perfect place to relax after taking in everything Cambridge and it's surrounding areas have to offer.

FULL/DOUBLE size bed.

There is NO television set.
There is NO parking.

The kitchen is an open plan kitchenette, equipped with a small fridge, microwave and induction cooktop (no oven).

Guest access
You'll have the whole apartment to yourself.
My parents live on the first floor and my mother helps me coordinate check-ins/outs when I'm away.
neighborhood_overview: Just outside Inman Square in a safe and tree-lined neighborhood, we are in walking distance to a number of great restaurants and cafes, independent grocery shops (and two Whole Foods), the beautiful Main Branch of the Cambridge Public Library, two pharmacies, a hospital, parks and playgrounds.
host_about:
I'm an artist/educator splitting my time between Cambridge and Heath, MA and Leipzig, Germany. 
In addition to art, I love hiking and camping, yoga, and gluten-free cooking.

neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is a tree lined residential area with many pocket parks and families. It is centrally located and surrounded by the Charles River, Harvard Square, Central Square, MIT and Boston (Fenway on one end, Back Bay on the other). Central Square is home to a 'high-end hipster' type of feel with every type of cuisine, active nightlife, and many small businesses.
host_about:
I started as an airbnb host in early 2013 when I was a management consultant on the road constantly. Since then Ive settled down  and now rent these spaces full-time. It is nice that I am now in the city I love year round and makes it easier to help my guests with any planning and coordination - I'm proud to say I've been a "Superhost" the entire time I've hosted! 

This funky rainbow flat is owned by me and is not a sublet. You will have the entirety of this Cambridgeport gem to yourself with no worries of shared spaces or other roommates. I grew up 5 blocks from my apartment and am a lifelong Cambridge resident - I love this area and am happy to share my hidden faves!

name: Spacious Cambridge 1BR near Kendall Square & MIT
description:
Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.

The space
Residents will enjoy their new luxury home equipped with beautiful design features such as gourmet kitchens with Shaker-style birch cabinets, tile floors and granite counter tops, luxurious bathrooms and expansive windows.

Property amenities include:

• Fitness center (fee)
• Business center
• Club room with video conference & caterers’ kitchen
• Fitness center (availalbe for a fee)
• Meeting rooms with 45" LCD screen with surround sound
• Elevator
• Mezzanine terrace with a garden
• Zen garden with WiFi
• Beautiful lobby with museum art
• Magnificent architectural and interior design
• Constructed with sensitivity to energy consumption an
neighborhood_overview: This community is located in Kendall Square which has become one of the most exciting places to visit with endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.     CambridgeSide Galleria Mall  0.6 miles  Massachusetts Institute of Technology  0.4 miles  Harvard University  1.9 miles  Harvard Museum of Natural History  2.2 miles  Cambridge Common 2.5 miles
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Bright Convenient Apt Harvard / MIT
description:
This 600 sf apt with roof deck on the third floor of an old Victorian home is bright and airy. Surrounded trees it does become a sanctuary, a place to call "home". Centrally located and within walking distance to MIT, Novartis, Harvard. It is within minutes walk to the Central Sq subway, station.

The apartment is efficiently laid out with a loft feel. It has a bedroom with king size bed, bath, kitchen, and living area with a ligne roset pullout couch/bed, plus a 230 feet deck.

The space
Renovated recently the space is bright airy space with views out. The deck from the living area gives with its surrounding trees gives the place a feel of a sanctuary. Good for relaxation in the midst of your travel. The living dining room is furnished to be a home which can also be used for travel work.

Guest access
Laundry in the basement if needed, the key to the front door works for the basement. The basement is kept clean but is unfinished.
neighborhood_overview:
In Central Square, easy access to lots of restaurants and bars. walking distance to Inman Square, Kendall Sq, Harvard Sq. Minutes to downtown on the subway. Easy access to zip cars and hubway bicycle service. There are three grocery stores within 5 minutes, Whole Foods, H-Mart and Harvest Coop.

There are a few drinking places; the Fields, Phoenix Landing, the Druid (Inman Sq) and Plough and Stars. They all serve food.

Restaurants are also abundant. It has a concentration of ethnic restaurants. For Indian, Central Square has Shalimar, India Pavilion and many others. There is Central Kitchen, Viale, Oleana, Ole, Casa Portugal, Dumpling House (Chinese) and Four Burgers. Flour is a short walk toward MIT and is known for its baked good and breakfast.

name: Charming Harvard Victorian
description:
Charming Victorian a 10 minute walk or 5 min trolley ride to Harvard square. Close to MIT and Harvard.

Nestled up to Harvard sq. our home has stunning old charm with great period character and one off street parking space.

The space
This beautiful 125+ year old home offers approximately over 1900 sq feet of indoor living space. Off the kitchen is relaxing deck with table that's perfect for breakfast, brunch, dinner or happy hour. The home also boasts a beautifully landscaped garden yard with relaxing front porch and backyard seating

The home has stunning vaulted/Abbey ceilings on the top floor, big screen TV and lots of comfortable sitting venues to relax and enjoy its Victorian charm.

While you don't really need a car in this area, as the 'T' stop to Harvard sq with access to all of Boston is across the street, the home offers one and sometimes two street parking, a rarity in Cambridge!

At 1900 sq ft with fou
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, Radcliff, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.  I really enjoy any sort of cultural event and great conversation.

In Phoenix, we have tried to provide the perfect sanctuary to get away and yet still see everything the city has to offer for events, shopping, dining, and natural beauty.  North Scottsdale near Kierland is absolutely the perfect location to be.

In Cambridge/Boston we are working with a 124-year-old Victorian.    It's beautiful with a lot of New England charm.   Many homes of the type in the area are gut remodeled and turned into condos or modern style living spaces.  We are working hard to maintain its hand-built Victorian charm while greening its infrastructure where possible and protecting it for future generations.   It's literally an antique we feel more like stewards than owners of.

We are now sharing these homes with others and using any money we earn to further the renovation projects.   We hope to meet people that will continue with us on this journey and get to enjoy things each time they come back as we further improve the spaces for all to enjoy.

A cozy and artistic haven in the heart of historic Harvard Square. Perfect for the visiting scholar, business traveler, or proud parent of a very accomplished student. I love being able to share my home with you and look forward to you stay!

Since this is my actual home, and not a vacation property, I only accept request:

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is beautiful. There are MANY great restaurants, shops, cafes and places to visit around the area. The Charles River is just 2 blocks away and is a beautiful place to walk or run.
host_about:
Hello! I'm Originally from Nashville TN, but went to school in Evansville IN for undergrad, and Cambridge MA for my Master's. I love traveling, the arts, reading and getting to know people from all over the world. Pleasure to "meet' you! Feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

A Few Facts About Me:

-I'm a professional performer.

-I have been to over 18 different countries and 3 continents.

-Six Characters in Search of An Author by Luigi Pirandello is my favorite play.

-My dad took me to see Phantom of the Opera when I was 8. He was afraid I’d find it boring. I gripped the seat in front of me the entire show and have since seen it 10 times. I think theater should be mandatory in schools.

- I love adrenaline sports like, Skydiving and Bungee Jumping.

-I was clearly born in the wrong time period. I prefer vintage clothes, classic TV, and I wish my name was Ella Fitzgerald.

-I love Indian food, and sushi, and southern food and… oh dear…

-I have a farm in Paris Tennessee.

CambridgeSide Galleria Mall  0.6 miles  Massachusetts Institute of Technology  0.4 miles  Harvard University  1.9 miles  Harvard Museum of Natural History  2.2 miles  Cambridge Common 2.5 miles
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

description:
Welcome to our fully furnished 2-bedroom apartment just steps away from Harvard University & MIT in the heart of Harvard Square. Our peaceful & tastefully decorated unit is perfect for light sleepers & features study desks in each room. The Red Line station is nearby for easy transportation. Contact us before booking to ensure personalized experience during your stay. Enjoy all that Harvard Square has to offer, including restaurants, shops & cultural attractions. We look forward to hosting you!

The space
Welcome to our cozy 2-bedroom apartment in the heart of Harvard Square, one of the most upscale neighborhoods in Cambridge.

The master bedroom features a comfortable queen-size bed, while the second bedroom has two single beds that can be joined to create a king-size bed. The living room also has a great sofa for additional sleeping space.

Enjoy natural light streaming into the apartment, giving it a warm and inviting ambiance. The full bath
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the best of Cambridge from this prime location. Just a 3-minute stroll to Harvard Square and a 10-minute walk to Central Square Station, you'll have easy access to the rest of the city. Enjoy great coffee shops, top-rated restaurants and bars, and explore the city's vibrant cultural scene.

Other nearby attractions include the magnificent Cambridge Public Library and its beautiful park, just half a block away. For your convenience, a full grocery store and drug stores are only a 3-minute walk away.

Getting around is a breeze, with all major bus stops and the Harvard Square Red Line just minutes away. Whether you're here to be part of the Harvard community or heading to Boston, this unbeatable location puts it all within reach.
host_about:
Harvard affiliate, design enthusiast, love to host and toast. The rest is history. Beyond all of the above, there is only one reason doing what we do- We are people's people :-).

The Queen Anne style house circa 1870's is in a quiet neighborhood, with pleasant walks near the Charles River. Nearby, on Concord Avenue, are buses to Harvard Square and public transport to Boston and other areas.

The space
This is a non-smoking house with a living room, dining room and kitchen on the first floor and three bedrooms on the second floor. One of those three is the owner's private bedroom. My dog is friendly and well behaved. Generally after greeting you he will
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential with a mixture of families with children, Harvard students and  professional people.   Our streets are not busy except in the morning and early evening hours when there is more street traffic. There are no  pubs, restaurants, entertainment areas except on nearby Huron Avenue, 2 blocks away there are some shops and restaurants frequented by the locals. Many more can be found not far away on Massachusetts Avenue and in Harvard, Central, Porter and Davis Squares .   During the day, the pleasantries of hearing children when they come out for recess from the two schools a block away is a happy sound, for me anyway.  Harvard University is  on the perimeter of our neighborhood.  M.I.T and other universities are easily reached by public transportation.
host_about:
I grew up in the Boston area, but lived some time in Europe and many years in Argentina and still have family and friends in Argentina.  

Interests cover much from enjoyment of nature, environmental concerns, sports and many cultural venues.  Work entails landscape design and maintenance focusing on ecology as well human impacts on land. 

Painting mainly on fine porcelain, writing and photography, music and theatre satisfy artistic desires.   I prefer to travel to places to live as a temporary resident to learn about other people, places and customs.

I also enjoy interacting with people of different backgrounds and countries around the world.  It is one of the most satisfying learning experience.

host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Friendly Pleasant Place
description:
Our comfortable bedroom with adjoining private bathroom, and a large (shared) living room area, is on the 1st floor with the hosts living on 2nd floor. The bedroom looks onto a small garden with access to a patio. Ideally located on a dead end street, near downtown, close to subway. Beautiful area.

The space
5 blocks from Central Square, Cambridge, and the Red Line, MBTA Subway station. Walking distance (less than a mile) to both Harvard and MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology).

In addition to the queen bed in the room, we can add a very comfortable queen air mattress and/or a single foam pad for extra people.

Guest access
On the first floor, adjacent to where the room is located, there is a limited kitchen with simple amenities. Microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, eating utensils (plates, bowels, spoons, forks, knives), toaster and sink available. There is no stove nor hotplate. We do not provide breakfast.
neighborhood_overview: We live on a quiet dead end street very close many of Cambridge and Boston's amazing places
host_about: We are a couple with professional jobs. The adult children have left us for their own adventures after college. We enjoy sharing our space with other responsible world citizens. We love music, healthy food, gardening, hiking, movies and sacred space. We speak a few languages and enjoy hearing from people around the world as to how we can become loving humans.

name: Harvard Square / MIT Comfy 2 Bed
description:
Contact before placing booking!

Simple layout, MODEST full apartment. There are some decor changes in the living room. Please ask us about it. Furnished well lit 2 bed 1 bath w computer desks/chairs, cookware, dinnerware etc. In the heart of Harvard Sq. Harvard T-station/Harvard Yard is 3 block away (5 minute walk). 3 minute walk to restaurants/grocery store. 15 minute walk to Central Sq., Whole Foods. Very close to HBS, HLS, and HKS campuses.

Its NOT a Handicap Unit. And strictly not PETS.

The space
A simple to live, modest full 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment in the heart of Harvard square.

AC only in the living room.

Guest access
1 queen size bed, 1 full size bed. beautiful 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment located next to the Harvard Faculty Club in Harvard Square. Walk or take train to Boston. Easily Accessible great location.

AC in living room only but good enough to cool both rooms.

We are
neighborhood_overview:
You cannot beat this amazing location. Lovely Harvard Square neighborhood. In walking distance to T (4 minutes walk), restaurants, grocery, public library and all Harvard and MIT facilities except the Medical School.

If you like to run, bring on your running shoes and run the Charles River. You can also rent a kayak on the river.


✓✓✓The person who is booking should be present for the booking and if you are not, you should receive a consent from us before you book.
host_about:
Harvard affiliate, design enthusiast, love to host and toast. The rest is history. Beyond all of the above, there is only one reason doing what we do- We are people's people :-). 

★★★★★★★★

FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking
www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/104

FAQ: For How to Book
www.airbnb.com/help/question/85

FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation
Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent. 

FAQ: For How to Contact Airbnb Support
www.airbnb.com/help/question/9

FAQ: How and when do I make a payment for my reservation?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/92

www.airbnb.com/help/question/100

FAQ: How are cleaning fees added?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/58

FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/51

Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made.

Below is the FAQ on airbnb “Why can’t I call or email a host before booking?”: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

For Pricing, at the listing page, enter check in date, check out date and total number of guests. The system will auto generate the price for your consideration. Regarding the currency display, it depends on your own setting, you can change your currency setting at the lower left panel of your airbnb page under the "LANGUAGE", you will see "CURRENCY" setting. Just click on it to change to any currency that you wish to display.

- Return Customer or Host or Guest with positive reviews with whatever possible discount on top of their daily / weekly / month rate OR VIP customer that keep booking over certain accumulated nights that I will offer extra discount OR Customer who had referred me many booking :-)

name: Lovely East Cambridge Apartment
description:
This second floor apartment is situated a short distance from MIT, steps away from Kendall Square and very close to public transportation to get to Harvard Square, the Charles River and Boston. Walking distance to great restaurants.
You will be given a 4 digit code that will allow you to come and go as you please. We understand how hard it is to travel with kids so we are equipped for young families with pack & plays, a stroller and portable high chair.

The space
The apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood between Kendall and Inman Square. There are great restaurants and an ample amount of parks within walking distance.

The apartment will be fully furnished with new beds, linens, stocked kitchen, and plenty of amenities for you to have a comfortable stay.

There are 2 large bedrooms and one smaller one. One bedroom has a queen, one bedroom has 2 twins and there is another twin bed in the smaller bedroom. There is an up

host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of airbnb and the idea of communal living.  As a young family we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and yard.

Cheery eat-in kitchen, dining room, and private patio dining - great yard and gardens to relax in. Comfortably-appointed bedrooms located at opposite ends of the unit, one queen, one double. In between, a sun-dappled living room with Fire TV Stick for streaming on the flat screen - sign in on the Fire Stick and stream your Netflix, Amazon Prime or XfinityGo, etc. Walk to MIT, Harvard, Boston, great restaurants every which way.

The space
This is a wonderful floor-through apartment, two bedrooms, one bath - tons of light, shared yard, set right on the Cambridge/Boston line, a few blocks from MIT. It's a very short walk to the Red Line or Green Line, an easy walk to Central Square, Kendall Square, Inman Square or Boston. I have walked to Newbury Street in 15 minutes at a good clip. name: Harvard/MIT
description:
This private room with queen size bed is cozy and comfortable.

The space
This is a cozy bedroom with a double bed, wi-fi, closet and plenty of books!

During your stay, you're welcome to use the kitchen for storing food, cooking or just sitting down for a morning coffee. The shared bath has a shower.

We work from home so are usually around to give you directions or suggestions of where to go and what to see if you are unfamiliar with Cambridge and Boston.


This is a great location to call home during your stay in Cambridge. The neighborhood is relaxed and friendly. We are within walking distance of Central, Harvard, Inman and Kendall Squares, with their many fine restaurants and theaters, music and sports venues.

Other things to note
Therman and I live here, so we will be around if you need anything. There may also be one other guest here during your stay. We are both up to date on our
host_about: Hello! My name is Nan and my partner's name is Therman. We've lived in Cambridge for years, and in the Boston area for way longer than that, so we can answer most questions you may have about how to get from here to there and what there is to see and do in this beautiful city. Currently, by trade we are used book merchants, although our pasts include many great adventures ranging from musician to milk man! We look forward to meeting you and hope you enjoy your stay in Cambridge.

Two bedroom third floor apartment with back porch. Just a 15 minute walk to Harvard Square.

We are located in a quiet neighborhood near public transportation, it is only a fifteen minute walk to Harvard Sq. The back porch is a beautiful spot for eating or relaxing three seasons of the year. There are 2 bedrooms and an eat-in-kitchen. There is no central living room.

There is also a very large window bench seat (8' x 3') on the lower level which easily sleeps an adult or bigger kid, and is also very comfortable. In the kid's room will be plenty of toys if you are bringing a little one! We can also provide a pack&play for an infant.

description:

• Fitness center (fee)

neighborhood_overview: This community is located in Kendall Square which has become one of the most exciting places to visit with endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.     CambridgeSide Galleria Mall  0.6 miles  Massachusetts Institute of Technology  0.4 miles  Harvard University  1.9 miles  Harvard Museum of Natural History  2.2 miles  Cambridge Common 2.5 miles
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

description:

I don't provide breakfast, but you're free to use the piano, refrigerator, stove, and microwave.

My MassTax account is PIT-16592679-002.

The space
A perfect spot for the night!

The "couch" is actually a captain's bed - a flat, slightly-narrower-than-twin-sized bed, rather than a couch with cushions. There will be sheets, a pillow with pillow case, and blankets.

neighborhood_overview: Looks like country, close to town.
host_about:
Please note:  The cat owns the house. If you have cat allergies, please find another space.

My motto: 
Creative solutions to unexpected challenges.

I'm disabled, but I still live independently.  You can ride my stair lift down to the basement washing machine! - but you can fold it up and walk down the steps, if you prefer.

Classical music is my life... Gilbert and Sullivan has been my fun... but I don't enjoy most popular music.

I've done many things, and (as my disability grows) have given up many things... so I'm exploring things I can still do.

name: Sunny 3 Bdr corner luxury apartment
description:
This sunny corner apartment in a modern building houses 6 comfortably. Two rooms have queen murphy bed/sofas, and the last a twin daybed and trundle bed. A short walk from Central Square, MIT and Harvard. Enjoy gourmet kitchen and dining area.

The space
This apartment has three sleeping spaces. Each space can be converted from a bedroom into an entertainment space or workspace. It is ideal for longer stays in which the occupants want to work, entertain, cook at home, exercise at home, etc. Because each room can transform from a bedroom into a living room, there is no separate living room. neighborhood_overview: Beside being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).   A new coffee shop/craft beer shop (Lamplighter) just opened across the street.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Lux Kendall Square 1 Bedroom w/gym, WiFi
description:
Design and sophistication describe this apartment and the Kendall Square area. Leading academic institutions like MIT, innovative restaurants with all types of cuisine, a big selection of shopping centers, and the proximity to the Kendal/MIT metro make this apartment your perfect headquarters to explore Cambridge and Boston. Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This top-notch community next to the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.

Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. name: Family Friendly 3 Bedroom
description:
This 3-bedroom apt in modern building sleeps up to 8. High quality mattresses and bedding. Two rooms have queen beds. Another bedroom has a twin over full bunk bed with a pull-out twin-size trundle. A short walk from Central Square, MIT and Harvard. Enjoy gourmet kitchen and dining area.

The space
Sick of poor sleep on bad mattresses? This apartment is ideal for a family or group that is looking for a high quality extended stay. The master bedroom has a queen bed, ample storage and a sitting area, as well as a two-sink private bath with large shower. The second bedroom features a twin over full bed while the third bedroom has a queen bed. A second shared bath with bathtub also houses the full-size washer/dryer. The dining area can seat up to 8 while the living room features a 50 inch smart HDTV. Cook in the fully-equipped gourmet kitchen instead of dining out. Extra twin mattress and bedding.

There is a Keur
neighborhood_overview: Besides being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: 5BR Home in Cambridge
description:
Great home for families our large groups with off street parking and easy access to public transit.

Dogs allowed for an additional $50 per day fee (2 dogs max). Please mention in your request if you are bringing a dog. No cats due to allergies.

The space
Our home is unique in that it is a 5 bedroom home with plenty of beds in Cambridge with easy access into Boston.

Window air conditioning units are available for the common space and 3 of the 5 bedrooms.

The master bedroom has a queen sized bed. The other four bedrooms have double beds and each room has an additional mattress (2 normal sized twin mattresses, one slightly smaller memory foam twin mattress, and 1 toddler mattress). The extra mattresses are tucked behind the clothing storage units and have low ceilings, but could work well for children or young adults (see photo). They can be pulled out into the bedroom if preferred. We also have a double air mattress which cou
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quieter section of Cambridge.  Fresh Pond Reservation across the street has a 2 mile path for walking or jogging and many wooded areas to explore.  There are several great playgrounds within a short walk, and an assortment of small shops less than half a mile away in Huron Village, including a toy store, a grocery store, and a couple restaurants.  We live 1.5 miles from Harvard Square.  It is a very nice walk there, a 10 minute bus trip, or a $6-8 Uber ride.  Note that we do live on a busy road and traffic noise can be heard inside the house.  When windows are closed, it is barely noticeable.
host_about: We love to travel internationally with our four children and make our home available to other travelers while we are away.
