name: Harvard & MIT- Sweet Retreat in Coolest Cambridge!
description:
Our Sweet Retreat is quietly hidden away in the heart of Cambridge, steps from a cafe, bike sharing, MBTA, Harvard, MIT, shops, and eateries — as well as equidistant to Harvard, Inman, and Central Squares. The apartment is comfortably furnished and INCLUDES off street PARKING!

We will greet you and point you to the historical, artsy, free, outdoors, music, restaurants, beaches, and etc. As friendly, long time Cambridge residents (designers and world travelers!), we know the hidden gems too.

The space
This apartment is a hidden gem. It is bright, cheery, quiet, and steps away from every mode of transportation and convenience you need to enjoy all that Cambridge (and beyond) has to offer.

The main room has a comfortable space for sitting and a long L shaped counter for working or sipping coffee. There is an apartment sized refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and electric tea pot — along with dishes, bowls, and etc. It does not have a stove
neighborhood_overview: This is an old neighborhood of owner occupied homes once used as servants' quarters for the Brattle Street mansions near Harvard Square in the old, Victorian days. We neighbors all know each other, so things run smoothly. It is safe, quiet, friendly, and has GREAT coffee steps away.
host_about: Artist, textile/accessories designer, and global traveler with a particular love for Asian markets, vintage textiles, and artisans !! My daughter and I lived in Vietnam for the better part of 7 years, and our home is definitely a mini gallery of our travels. I am positive you will feel very happy to be in the midst of lovely colors, interesting books, and, best of all, in a seemingly quiet corner of Cambridge, tucked away, that in actuality — is in the center of all!

name: Live Large in Transformable Studio
description:
A 12'x12' living room, a 12'x12' bedroom, a study, a walk-in closet, a kitchen, bathroom in a studio? You can do it with architectural robotics. Come experience the future of housing based on work straight out of MIT.

The space
Live large in a small space using robotic closets and bed. By day enjoy your full-size living room with a sofa, a bench and a 42" flat screen TV. By night, press a button and the queen bed is at your disposal. The luxurious bathroom, fully equipped kitchen and washer/dryer make this studio live like a comfortable one-bedroom unit. The sofa converts to a small futon, suitable for children ages 2-12. For older folks, please note that the bed is close to the floor.

Other things to note
There is a Keurig & regular coffee maker. A starter supply of paper goods, detergent, soap, shampoo etc. is provided. Portacrib, vacuum, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and cleaning supplies are also available for use.

name: Private Apartment. Dog friendly. Parking
description:
Take advantage our private, cozy Cambridge home. It is minutes from Harvard Sq. and Boston. Its close proximity to Fresh Pond is a bonus. Our friendly, Strawberry Hill neighborhood offers easy parking, great local eateries or a quiet night in. Dog friendly!

The space
Our private, cozy Cambridge apartment is minutes from Harvard Sq. and Boston. Its close proximity to Fresh Pond is a bonus. Our friendly, Strawberry Hill neighborhood offers easy free parking, great local eateries or a quiet night in. The comforts of home. We also welcome your dog. Please let us know if you will be bringing your dog. Dogs must be house trained. If you have more than one dog please check with us first.

Guests have access to the entire private 1st floor apartment and 1 parking space in front of the house (regular sized vehicle) or there is additional parking on the street. We are located in West Cambridge, near Harvard Square and are an easy commute to Boston. Within a ten
neighborhood_overview: Strawberry Hill is a very friendly neighborhood between Huron Ave and Mount Auburn Street. There are numerous little places by local owners offering a multitude of food within a ten minute walk.  All along Belmont Street one can find - Sofra ( a spinoff from Oleana) is a quick walk away; Eastern Lemejun has delicous Armenian & middle eastern offerings; Conleys Pub and sports bar is always serving up food and drinks; Homemade Greek yogurts and foods can be found at Sophia's on Belmont St, and just before that Linda's Donuts makes the best home made donuts from scratch every morning; Fiorellas has pizza and Italian; At Aram's Cafe, one can get a breakfast or lunch cooked by Aram himself, whose establishment has been cooking up delicious entrees for over 30 years; Moozies Ice cream for homemade ice cream and an outdoor movie screen in warm weather. There is a large supermarket, liquor store and drug store in Star Market as well as local food shops. The Fresh Pond Golf Course and Waterwork
host_about: I am an artist, cook, gardener, mom and teacher. I love to bike around FreshPond, kayak on the Charles River, watch my children's sports games, head to Rhode Island (my hometown ) for the beach. I love the city and all it has to offer.

name: Cambridge Modern Living
description:
This cozy modern apartment is conveniently located a 5 minute car ride or 8 minute bus ride from Harvard Square, on a quiet residential street. The apartment is one block away from the 71 and 73 bus lines that run straight to Harvard Square. There is a couch or air mattress and shared bath available for you in this quaint 1 bedroom, 1 bath modern apartment.

The space
This sun filled flat is the ideal Cambridge location. I am a 5 minute car or bus ride from the Harvard Square stop of the Red Line MBTA train and Harvard University, and steps away from one of the best Turkish cafes (Sofra) in the Boston area! There is a grocery store (with Starbucks), dry cleaners, shoe repair, bank, and pharmacy conveniently located across the street. Fresh Pond and Mt. Auburn Cemetery (two of Cambridge's top destinations) are a 10 minute walk away. There are a number of coffee shops and restaurants all within a 5 minute radius! The beautiful Charles River is an enjoyable 10 minute
neighborhood_overview:
Here are a few of my favorite things about my location:
1) Restaurants/Cafes/Bars less than 0.25 miles away include: Sofra, Red Lentil, Greg's, Cha Yen Thai Cookery, Deluxe Town Diner, Seta's Cafe, The Village Kitchen.
2) I love walking around and enjoying the beautiful homes, gardens and parks in the neighborhood.
3) Proximity to Harvard Square - you really can't beat it. You can be at the heart of Harvard Square in less than 5 minutes by bus or car.
4) Great live music - There are a number of live music venues nearby.
5) The Cambridge Public Library and newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are beautiful spaces with great architectural design and are within a walking distance from my place and they both are great places to spend the day.
6) Fresh Pond and Mt. Auburn Cemetery, two highlights, are within a 10 min walk.
host_about:
I'm a Designer/Education Entrepreneur. My company is based in Boston, but I'm a native Californian. I grew up in Southern California and got transplanted to the chilly East Coast. Let's just say, I'm still getting used to the winters!

I've been living in Cambridge for the past 6 years, and have come to enjoy the intellectual environment and diversity of the city.

I love art, electronic music, traveling, trying new restaurants, watching indie movies, and working on interactive art projects in my spare time.

host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing. name: Charming Third Floor Apartment
description:
Third floor of lovely 19th century house, nicely landscaped and set back from the street. A private retreat ideally located in a quiet neighborhood between Harvard and Porter Square, close to some of the best restaurants and shops in Cambridge, minutes from the Redline. Sunny and spacious with two bedrooms and a separate food preparation/living and dining area.

The space
Three attractive, cozy rooms and a spacious bathroom with a claw tub and separate shower on the third floor of a mansard style victorian house in the heart of Cambridge. The two bedrooms have comfortable beds with fine, all cotton bed linen and plenty of pillows. The food preparation area in the living room is equipped with high quality appliances - a coffee maker, large toaster oven and microwave, mini fridge and freezer - not a full kitchen but much more than you would find in any hotel room. The living area also has a 42" TV with HBO and Showtime. The apartment has its own private lockable
neighborhood_overview: The area between Harvard and Porter Squares is one of the most lively and interesting parts of Cambridge, as is Davis Square which is also nearby. Temple Bar, Giulia, and numerous other great restaurants, takeout places and cafes are right around the corner. Abodeon, Pod, Nomad, and Joie de Vie plus the unusual vintage stores and music venues of Davis square are just a few of the interesting possibilities. The Peabody Museum with its exquisite glass flowers and the newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are within walking distance.

name: Sunny Huron Village Apt. w/ Terrace
description:
Our two-family home in West Cambridge includes a new one bedroom apartment on first floor, with sunny bedroom, living room, new kitchen & bath, as well as a wonderful private garden terrace. Easy commute to Harvard Sq on foot or by bus. Excellent WiFi for working remotely.

The space
This sunny, spacious one-bedroom apartment has its own front entrance and side terrace with café table, tucked on the first floor of our two-family home. We’ve furnished it with New England antiques to complement the brand new kitchen and modern bath with shower. New queen bed perfect for one or two guests. Full kitchen with stove, dishwasher and microwave. We follow Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocols.

This is a dream apartment for those coming to explore Cambridge, visit the universities, or see all of Boston. Nestled in an upscale residential neighborhood, it is a foodie’s haven with artisanal bakery, gourmet cheese shop, old fashion butcher and great restaurant
neighborhood_overview: West Cambridge is a hot neighborhood at the moment, with great urban amenities and excellent green spaces. Nestled between the historic homes of Brattle St, the unique shops of Huron Village and the green spaces of Fresh Pond reservoir and Danehy Park, there's lots to do and see. Jog or walk the 2 mile loop around the Pond, explore historic neighborhoods and sample the many interesting food shops. Or wander down to Harvard Square and all the university has to offer with museums and bookstores galore. Major retailers like Whole Foods and Starbucks are also a short walk away.
host_about:
I have lived in Cambridge for over 25 years.  I moved here for graduate school at Harvard and never left.  Currently, I'm a baker and  pastry chef  ( (Hidden by Airbnb) :  @hazelnama ) working part time in local bakeries.   However, my primary job is raising our eleven year old son.

I love to travel and have been all over world (most of that before having a child).  My partner and I spend a good deal of time in Maine but are plotting trips much further out as our son gets a little older.  

As a host I'm very accessible but mostly hands off.  I'm more than happy to answer any questions, point you in the direction of great restaurants or sights but tend to let our guests enjoy the space as they like.

name: Luxury Harvard/MIT Victorian
description:
Newly remodeled Victorian with all the Victorian charm, yet modern convenience in the best location. Our home features traditional soapstone counters and sink, luxury Japanese soaking tub with a huge rainfall showerhead, coffee machine to get you going in the morning, and tons of charm. Perfect for 4-5 Adults +/- children

The space
Our home is a two bedroom in a beautiful 124 year old Victorian home surrounded by a beautifully gardened yard. We’ve just completed extensive remodeling to a modern style while paying homage to and by preserving much of its Victorian elements and charm.

Our home easily accommodate 4-5 adults. We do have an high end queen sized stay firm inflatable airbed for guests with children/teens if needed.

Inside we have two bedrooms each with queen sized beds with luxury mattresses. Either or both of the rooms can be setup for you to be a work-space/office configuration complete with internet, large screen monitors, ke
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, MIT, Radcliffe, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.  I really enjoy any sort of cultural event and great conversation.

In Phoenix, we have tried to provide the perfect sanctuary to get away and yet still see everything the city has to offer for events, shopping, dining, and natural beauty.  North Scottsdale near Kierland is absolutely the perfect location to be.

In Cambridge/Boston we are working with a 124-year-old Victorian.    It's beautiful with a lot of New England charm.   Many homes of the type in the area are gut remodeled and turned into condos or modern style living spaces.  We are working hard to maintain its hand-built Victorian charm while greening its infrastructure where possible and protecting it for future generations.   It's literally an antique we feel more like stewards than owners of.

We are now sharing these homes with others and using any money we earn to further the renovation projects.   We hope to meet people that will continue with us on this journey and get to enjoy things each time they come back as we further improve the spaces for all to enjoy.

name: Unique Philadelphia Style Apartment Behind Harvard
description:
Escape to the Garfield Historical District and experience the charm of a bygone era in this Philadelphia-style apartment. Nestled on a picturesque residential street, this 1900 Victorian home boasts a bedroom on the second floor, providing guests with a spacious layout. A off-street parking spot in inlcuded for your convenience. Harvard Sq is a 17 min walk and Porter Sq is a mere 5 blocks. You'll be within easy reach of an abundance of amenities including Star Market, cafes and restaurants.

The space
Discover the perfect blend of vintage elegance and modern convenience in this one-of-a-kind hideaway. Just North of Harvard Yard and behind Harvard Law and Lesley University. Every desirable amentiy is within walking distance including grocery stores, pie shops, . Porter Square T-Stop is an 11-minute walk and Harvard Square is a 17 minute walk.

Ideal apartment for 4 people. There is wiggle room for a 5th person ( additional $50/night).

♦ Walk
neighborhood_overview:
Perks of booking a 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge:
- It is most likely cheaper then renting 2 hotel rooms
- It is more spacious than a hotel room and guests are able to spread out amongst themselves
- $35/night savings with the parking space included
- The kitchen is stocked, and you can save money by preparing meals and storing snacks
- Location and organic experience living in a residential neighborhood in the City

All considerations of 17Traymore are greatly appreciated. In order to ensure that your visit to Cambridge fits your needs, it is important to know that this apartment is not a good fit if you would like a space where you can have guests over. Please refer to house rules prior to booking.

● Located in the Baldwin (formerly Agassiz) neighborhood / Garfield Historical District in Cambridge, MA. This neighborhood way back when was referred to as North Harvard because the apartment is just North of Harvard Yard (and Harvard Law
host_about: Hello! I'm Kimberly. Originally from Syracuse, NY, I have lived in Cambridge for over 20 years and can brave any New England winter. This suburban city stole my heart from Day 1. My passion is being a mother to my 14 and 13 year old, and my 2 year old Mini Schnauzer. I love food in general (cooking, eating, reading about…), cross-stitching and dreaming about traveling the world.

name: Big 2 bedroom, steps to Davis Sq
description:
Spacious, sunny 2 bedroom, 6 room 1st floor of two-family, private entrance.
7-minute walk to Davis Sq & T-station, 1 min to Mass Ave bus. Queen and twin bed, Ful furnshd din rm, livrm, kit, washer/dryer.
Grt Location! (no pets) 4 month minimum stay!

The space
Large North Cambridge apartment, hardwood floors with original cherry & gumwood trim. Spacious living room and and dining room make it a comfortable space to relax after work or sight seeing or visiting. Well-appointed kitchen makes it easy to prepare a meal or just enjoy take out. On nice summer evening the back porch is a delightful place for dinner, cocktails, or just enjoying the yard and quiet. We can provide an additional inflatable mattress if needed.

Guest access
You have the full use of the first floor and back porch. The basement and upper floors are the owner's space, so please respect that.
neighborhood_overview:
North Cambridge ( NoCa) is a wonderful quiet neighborhood, and Hollis is one of the nicest streets in NoCa! It is a one way street, and traffic on the street is pretty light. Massachusetts ave is just abut 100 yards up, and within a 5 minute walk you will find many fine restaurants ( two sushi, one Greek, one Italian, one Vietnamese- French, one steak house, one Chinese), a produce market, a dry cleaner, and three banks. There is a CVS in Porter square, about a 10 minute walk on Mass Avenue, and the MINUTE CLINIC there is open 8am- 7 pm.
Additionally, at the end of Rindge Avenue end of Hollis, you will find branch of the Cambridge Public Library, and great play ground with both toddler and "big kid" sections, ball fields, and tennis courts.
And if you are looking for more night life, Davis Square, with a huge variety of restaurants, bars, gift shops, and hipsters, is about a 7 minute walk.

description:
Easy Scenic walk to both Harvard and Porters Sq in Cambridge. Long-term stay in a comfortable, well-equipped, homey and welcoming apartment close to all of Cambridge's best attractions: vibrant Harvard Square, the magnificent Charles River, historic Brattle St, and Charles river. Minimum Monthly Stay and price reflects this.

The space
This is not an apartment primarily occupied by renters/owners and then vacated for guests - it is a dedicated guest apartment and as such, it is clean and uncluttered and you won't feel as if you are invading someone else's space.

Picture this: You’ve strolled the tree-lined streets of Cambridge. You’ve had some delicious food from one of the many, many excellent restaurants in the area. You’ve browsed the aisles of the Harvard Book Store, had some coffee, people watched, maybe gone on a local history tour. Now it's time to come home to an apartment so cosy, so comfortable, so quiet that you will immediately kick off your
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is rich in history and bustling with activity, full of beautiful examples of old colonial architecture and a wonderful town to walk in. All of the following are within a 5 minute drive or an easy 20 minute stroll from the apartment.
East:
Harvard Square
Harvard University
American Repertory Theater
Cambridge Common
Tory Row
Harvard Museum of Natural History

West:
Fresh Pond Park
Wholefoods
Mt. Auburn Cemetery
Apple Cinemas

South:
Longfellow House
The Charles River
The Charles River Bike Path

North:
Porter Square
Davis Square

Withing ten minutes of driving are MIT, Central Square, Kendall Square.

Hop across the river to get to Fenway Park, Newbury Street, the Museum of Fine Arts, and Boston's other attractions.

There is a binder in the apartment with information on great places to see and interesting things to do.
host_about: Academic prof at one of the colleges in Cambridge has an extra condo dedicated to airbnb guests. My girlfriend, who is German and myself love to travel all over the world to experience different peoples and cultures. We live in Cambridge not far from the units and absolutely love the neighborhood. We would love to host you in this very cosy space, tastely decorated and furnished condo that used to call our primary home.

Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This top-notch community next to the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.

The space
Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of T
neighborhood_overview: Dubbed as one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop and play in the Boston area, this walkable community is situated just one subway stop on the Red Line from Beacon Hill, two stops from Harvard Square and on the banks of the Charles River. host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

Additional guests are possible. Family friendly: games and bikes are available for use.

Our home is cozy, clean, and fun and perfect for families w/kids and larger groups.
On the first floor is the living room (with TV/DVD player but no cable), kitchen (fully equipped with gas stove, Nepresso & espresso makers, blender, cooking &
neighborhood_overview: In our Cambridgeport neighborhood, you can walk to restaurants, cafes, and shops in Central and Harvard Squares, grocery stores (Whole Foods and Trader Joes), and the Charles River.  Dana Park (with sprinkler and playground) is a block away in this safe and family-friendly neighborhood, rich in diversity and culture.  You can bike into Boston along the Charles, go to the Red Sox, ride the swan boats in the Boston Common, visit the MFA, Aquarium, Science Museum, and much more!
host_about: I am a Middle Grade/Young Adult writer (High) and editor, and I teach at Harvard Summer School and Harvard Extension School.  Check out my website: (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more info.  I love to read, play soccer, swim, hike, bike, watch TV series, go to the beach, and travel when we can.  My husband teaches at Boston University, and we have 4 children.  Our favorite destinations are Martha's Vineyard, NH, Chautauqua, and northern CA.  Our motto: Life is good!

description:
This owner-occupied Victorian duplex is on a quiet, leafy, safe street AND a short 3 blocks from bustling Massachusetts Avenue: a 10 minute walk to Harvard Square and 5 minutes to Porter Square.
Your room has a double real bed. You are on the third floor, peaceful, cozy and quiet, right among the tree tops. At night you have the stars, and by day the room is light and sunny. Airy, modern kitchen, leafy yard, washer/dryer, wifi.

The space
The room is cozy, with wide, old pine board flooring, sky light with a room-darkening shade, closet, dresser, large desk with office supplies, yoga mat, full length mirror, a/c (when necessary) and a fan. This bedroom shares a full bathroom with the other third floor bedroom, Smack Dab 1. (FYI: there are 2 other bathrooms in the house). An iron and ironing board are available. I provide soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, first aid kit and other essentials.
PLEASE NOTE: your room is 29 stairs up 2 uncarpete
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around. And you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge. Or, if you are here in winter, the quiet of the cold air is lovely too, and if we are lucky, you'll see snow!

Along Mass Ave, you can walk to many local run businesses of every sort: gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Tokai), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise, Starbucks) and so many restaurants of every ethnicity (Indian, Japanese, Thai, Italian, Mexican, American). You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, through Harvard Square. You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place! Somerville is just minutes away too (Davis Square, Inman Square, Union Square), and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops
host_about:
Hello!  

I've lived in Cambridge for 38 years.  I am an artist;  I paint, draw and sculpt.   I am a rather quiet person, with a good sense of humor.   I live with two cats, Aiko and Minkah.  They are friendly and enjoy guests. 

I love living in Cambridge.  It's a rather small town with so much to offer.  Boston is also very close by, accessible by the subway, bus or Uber.  There's so much to see and do there as well!    

This is a wonderful neighborhood and I really love sharing it with people.  It is good to remember the ocean is also near by and it is accessible by subway, rail or bus.  There are countless historical sites, museums, restaurants and shopping experiences in the area.  

I hope you will consider visiting Cambridge and staying at Smack Dab!

Near MIT, innovative restaurants with all types of cuisine, shopping centers, and the proximity to the Kendall/MIT metro make this apartment your perfect HQ to explore Cambridge and Boston. Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This community near the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.

neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. name: Room near Alewife Red Line T stop.
description:
Room for female guests only in North Cambridge residential neighborhood, 5 min walk to Alewife red line T, next to bike path, 15 min walk to Davis Square. You room has hardwood floor, 2 windows, window AC (summer), large closet. Full size bed with memory foam mattress. There is a nice front porch and back yard, shared living room, study room, fully equipped kitchen, and a full bath. Your bedroom door has a keypad lock, so you have an option to keep it locked, if you like.

The space
Dear guest! As you can see in almost all of reviews from previous guests, we hold cleanliness to a high standard and clean apartment is our priority.

To prevent the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), we have implemented a comprehensive cleaning and sanitizing protocol. This includes sanitizing tables, counters, door and cabinet knobs.

I’d like to also ask all guests to follow CDC and the Massachusetts Department of Health guidelines and recommended techniques
neighborhood_overview: If you've never been to Cambridge, you will probably find it a very unique. The house is in a quiet residential area but you will have easy access to a trendy Davis Square (with great cafes, restaurants, theater), popular Harvard Square, beautiful bike path, jazz clubs and many other interesting venues.

name: Steps away from Harvard, Inman Sq
description:
All natural wood, great light. Clean and airy, air conditioned with wifi. The room has a desk and chair serving for a comfortable work space and accommodates one person. Please know that there is a second bedroom that accommodates one or two persons and when there are guest/s in that room the bathroom is shared with them.

Please note this is a bedroom in my home. It is not a hotel and I do my best to accommodate a guest’s request. I do request guests to be considerate when using shared spaces.

Guest access
Guests can have access to the kitchen, but this does not include cooking facilities. You are welcome to sit at the table and eat as well use the fridge. I always offer a range of teas and fruit that you are invited to have while staying here.

Other things to note
Please note that I have a second listing. When both rooms are booked the bathroom is shared.

I am a few minutes walk from Inman square; harvard square is a 15 minute walk and central square between 10-12 minutes.
there are many restaurants within walking distance. Walgreens is a stone’s throw, Whole Foods is less than five minutes away.
host_about:
I love to travel, meet people from all around the world. I enjoy reading, music, movies and spicy food.
I have loved visiting Italy, Hungary, Turkey and Mexico to name some.
You will find me warm and helpful as host.
My life motto is to treat others as I would like to be treated by them.

name: Convenient & Cozy in Cambridgeport
description:
As longtime Cambridge residents (Poppy, a retired educator & Marshall, a university administrator), we look forward to sharing our love of this area. Ours is an ideal location for sightseeing, college visits, conferences, cultural happenings and more!

The space
Ours is a three story single family home. The guest bedroom (with one full sized bed) is on the second floor with a newly renovated bathroom nearby (for your exclusive use.)

Guest access
In addition to the guest room, guests will have breakfast in the dining area on the first floor or on the small deck off the kitchen, when the weather is nice.

Other things to note
There is a 2 day minimum stay.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is tucked between Central Square and the Charles River.  There is a beautifully landscaped and newly renovated park and play area next door. We are walking distance to MIT and slightly longer walking distance to Harvard and Boston Universities. Numerous pharmaceutical companies are also a short walk away here in Cambridgeport.
host_about: We are educators who have lived in Cambridge for over 40 years and spend as much time as possible at on the Vineyard.

name: Cambridge Single Family -- Families and Pets!
description:
Rare single family in Cambridge, MA only rented twice a year! Three levels of historic and chic living: 2700sf. Family and dog friendly with stunning private, fenced, grassy and professionally landscaped backyard. 6 min walk to T public trans (10 min T or 5-10 min Uber to Harvard; 25m T to downtown Boston). Walk to restaurants of vibrant Porter and Davis Squares or lovely parks. Quiet, low-traffic street in safe and friendly neighborhood. Private driveway. "Green" features. Beyond compare!

The space
First floor has high-ceiling living room, family room (with baby grand piano), dining room, full bathroom, and kitchen with direct access to private deck and fenced yard and gardens. Yard and gardens are brand new (2019) and were designed and installed by a prominent local landscape architect. Chef's kitchen has a new (2020) Thermador stove and dishwasher and has radiant heat and a breakfast nook next to wall of windows looking out to private yard. Dining tab
neighborhood_overview: The North Cambridge neighborhood is the hidden gem of Cambridge.  Super-convenient "T" access.  Sports fields, playgrounds and multiple dog parks right around the corner.  Bike trail is about 5 minutes away.  Beautiful Fresh Pond and Danehy Park are very close by.  Many restaurants are within a short walk -- including two of greater Boston's highest rated restaurants (Table at Season to Taste and Urban Hearth).  Great casual restaurants in walking distance too--coffee shop, Mexican, Greek and others.  And then within a 15-20m walk are Davis and Porter Squares, with countless restaurants and bars.  Harvard Square is just slightly further (8 min Uber)  Above all, neighborhood is safe and family-friendly -- really nothing left to be desired!
host_about: Originally from Upstate NY, I am now a Bostonian with 16 years of experience!  I live with my husband, two young boys and one dog in Cambridge, MA and we LOVE it.  We would like to travel more and are looking into ways to make that happen!  So far we have been to: Paris, Bruges, London, Edinburgh, Rome, Dublin, Rio, Dominican Republic, Jamaica, Costa Rica, Bermuda, Alaska, Hawaii, Dubrovnik, Budapest, Vienna, Prague, and Berlin. Also around the continental US and Canada.  Next on the list will be Spain and maybe Iceland!

name: Big sunny artist's 1BR near Harvard
description:
Beautifully decorated apartment on tree-lined street just outside Inman Square in Cambridge.
Located conveniently near the Cambridge Public Library, Harvard, MIT and many restaurants/cafes.
15 minute walk to Harvard and Central Square (redline).

The space
Welcome to my charming, sun-filled, second floor apartment.

The bedroom has bay windows, pocket doors, and a queen size bed that sleeps two.

The office/studio/study has ample workspace for you to use.

The living room offers two sofas.

The eat in kitchen has a beautifully restored, fully functional gas stove and oven dating to 1925.
IMPORTANT: To use this stove you must be comfortable turning the gas line on and off and using a lighter to ignite the burners. I have an electric kettle and a Breville SmartOven for guests who are not comfortable with gas.

The bathroom is Euro-style, small but well designed with a walk in shower that you just sq
neighborhood_overview: Just outside Inman Square in a safe and tree-lined neighborhood, we are in walking distance to a number of great restaurants and cafes, independent grocery shops (and two Whole Foods), the beautiful Main Branch of the Cambridge Public Library, two pharmacies, a hospital, parks and playgrounds.
host_about:
I'm an artist/educator splitting my time between Cambridge and Heath, MA and Leipzig, Germany. 
In addition to art, I love hiking and camping, yoga, and gluten-free cooking.

neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

★★★★★★★★

FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent.

name: Beautiful oasis on Cambridge border
description:
Lovely, large, 2 bedroom, 2 bath home with stunning modern addition, 10 minutes from Harvard Square by car or bus, comes with an adorable cat for your playing pleasure. Calm atmosphere with comfortable living room, TV room, fenced-in backyard.

The space
Large, comfortable house on the Cambridge/Belmont border comes with a soft, cuddly and almost always adorable cat named Caleb. Ideal for relaxing, there is a spacious living room, separate TV room (with 55" set), dining room and fenced in, landscaped back yard replete with hammock, dining table and lounge chair. The master bedroom is huge with a California king bed, six windows and a cathedral ceiling. It has its own spa bathroom with Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. There is also a guest room with a queen bed and a fold-out couch in the TV room. (In the interest of full disclosure, the fold-out couch is not the most comfortable.) A second full bath is downstairs. The kitchen looks out on the garden and the
neighborhood_overview: I live on a rotary on large boulevard across from Cambridge.  Harvard Square is 2.6 miles from the house, (~10 minutes by car, 15 by bus) and the bus stop is steps away. You can also easily take public transportation from Harvard Square or Belmont Center or drive to downtown Boston (about 20 minutes).  Fall is an ideal time to visit New England and you will be 15 to 20 minutes away from Walden Pond in Lincoln and the many historical sights in Concord.  (Bring your bikes for some excellent riding either straight from the house or in Concord/Lincoln.)  Numerous beaches, apple-picking and mountain-climbing are about an hour away.  Belmont also has a number of nature preserves should you wish to take some local hikes.  Fresh Pond, a local wooded reservoir, is a favorite exercise spot with a 3 mile loop from the house.  Next to Fresh Pond (a 10 minute walk) is a 9-hole golf course.  There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance.  Guests will be provided with a guidebook, i
host_about: I am a vivacious, retired lawyer passionate about gardening, travel, social justice and exercise (hiking, biking, kayaking and yes, the gym).  I share my house with an adorable, cuddly cat named Caleb. Manhattan born and bred, I have striven to make my home a country-like oasis in a suburban environment. As a host, I seek to provide my guests with a comfortable, calm, luxurious base from which to work/play.

name: Lovely room: walk to  Harvard Square with parking
description:
It's a short walk to Central and Harvard Square. The room is lovely and quiet with high ceilings, two windows, wood floors, and a comfortable queen sized bed. There is a bureau, two chairs, and mirrors. The full bath is shared with myself and my daughter. There is a closet with hangers for your clothing and two of the bureau drawers are empty and available for you. There is an electric kettle, tea and water in your room as well as a few snacks. Your towels are in a basket in your closet.

The space
My 800 square foot apartment is clean and un cluttered with lovely light and wood floors. I have a sweet cockapoo who lives there. He is very friendly and is a hypoallergenic non shedding dog. I live here with my daughter.
You will share the bathroom with us. You may use it as your own and leave your things there, we do not leave anything in the bathroom when guests are here. There is shampoo, cream rinse, soap and hand lotion available for you. We don't leave our
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood has a tantalizing group of eclectic restaurants of all kinds and many places to have coffee. I have a guest book with menus and maps. The famous Plough and Stars pub is on the corner of Mass Ave and Hancock and they have live music most evenings. Improv Boston is just a few blocks away in Central Square. You can take the train downtown to Park Street to find the nearest theater, or go the Kendall Cinema in Kendall Square.
We are within walking distance of the beautiful recently renovated Harvard Art Museum as well as the Peabody Natural History Museum. If you love bookstores the Harvard Bookstore on Mass Ave is a treat as well as the tiny Grolier Bookstore which has only poetry, a Cambridge classic.
The Lizard Lounge just outside of Harvard Square is well known for its poetry slams on Sunday nights. Passim in Harvard Square is another local favorite if you want to hear folk music. The ART theater has two locations, one in Harvard Square for their main theatr
host_about: I am an actress and improv performer, teacher, writer, mother and dog lover. I love yoga and improv and  I am a vegetarian. I spqeak French relatively fluently and I love to travel. I practice meditation qqand I believe in the connectedness of all living beings.

name: Cambridge Summer! Harvard, Porter, Davis Squares
description:
Comfort and Location! This charming Cambridge apartment is on the first floor of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), including Harvard Sq. which is 1.5 miles away. You won't need a car - we are next to public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers, and all surrounding communities. SAVE! F YOU BOOK MORE THAN 31 NIGHTS, THERE ARE NO LOCAL OR STATE TAXES - PLUS YOU GET A SUBSTANTIAL DISCOUNT.

The space
This is a legal short-term rental, certified by the City of Cambridge, under its recent short-term rental ordinance. Weekly stays are available in July and August 2023. But there is no tax if you stay more than 31 nights!

The apartment is perfect for visiting faculty or graduate students and their families interested in a longer-term rental of a month or more.

The first floor apartment itself is a tastefully furnished two-bedroom, with a di
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

When part of my mother's family emigrated to Cambridge at the turn of last century from Co. Kerry, Ireland, they settled in our Hollis Street neighborhood that was once called "Little Dublin". Her cousins became successful funeral home owners and leaders in the Cambridge community. This neighborhood was also home to the famous House Speaker, "Tip" O'Neil, and has a rich history, dating back to the Revolutionary War. The first floor apartment is where my parents once lived and it has been renovated and is now available for you to enjoy.

name: ENJOY CAMBRIDGE THIS SUMMER AND BEYOND. SLEEPS 8+
description:
Your home away from home is steps to Harvard Square and has plenty of room for your whole family to spread out! You will be renting a large multi-level townhome with 3 bedrooms PLUS a sleeping loft PLUS a separate studio. It's conveniently located 1 block from Harvard University's campus and a 12-minute walk to the Harvard Sq T.

The space
Our space has two units including a 3 bedroom+ Loft and a separate studio unit. Great for larger groups and families.

The larger space has high ceilings, hardwood floors and a nice backyard for entertaining. The space has three bedrooms including master suite with queen mattress, two separate bedrooms each with a full size bed, and a sleeping loft with a twin size bed.

The second space is a studio that was recently painted, tastefully decorated, has a large king size bed and easily accommodates two additional guests.

Please take a few minutes to look at the pictures to get a better sense of t
neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet tree lined street steps away from the main Harvard campus and about a 10 minute walk to the train stop in Harvard Square. We are also close to grocery stores, parks, the library and a number of other amenities to make you feel at home.
host_about: My family and I are excited to share our family home with you. Work has relocated us, so, instead of renting our home to a regular tenant we want to share it's unique character, architecture and warmth with the Airbnb world.

name: A Room at the Top-sep. entr., mostly private bath
description:
The beauty of the outdoors meets the comfort of the indoors--windows all across the front, skylights in the cathedral ceiling, and French doors to a private balcony in the trees. Free internet, small fridge, coffee pot, separate entrance, parking.

The space
This is a bright and spacious room with skylights, a seating area in
addition to a sleeping area, fridge, microwave, coffee pot, French doors to
a balcony, queen-sized bed, air conditioning, 19-inch flat screen tv with
dvd player, and a radio, etc. There is free wireless access to the internet
in the room.

Guest access
Access to the room is by a separate entrance at the side of the house.
The room is located on the top (third) floor of our house. It is the only room that is used as a Bed and Breakfast-- Hence, our name: A Room at the Top. The bathroom is located across the hall from the room (about 6 feet away). During Covid restrictions the bathroom is completel
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a beautiful, historic conservation district with many beautiful gardens and well maintained homes from the 1800's. Restaurants, shops, transportation and parks are within a few minutes' walking distance. On-street parking is usually very easy and free with the use of a Visitor's Parking Permit, which we can lend to guests.

name: Cambridge Bed and Bath
description:
Lovely bedroom and full private bath in my home on quiet residential street, cozy, private, lots of natural light, or block the light with shades. Use of fully-equipped kitchen, dining room. Shops and restaurants nearby. 5 to 10-minute walk to Porter Square subway station, 20-minute walk or 5-minute subway ride to Harvard Square.

Guests must be fully vaccinated against COVID. Please bring proof of vaccination. Thank you.

The space
The bedroom is quiet and peaceful, in the back of the house with a nice view of back yards and trees. The bed is very comfortable, not too soft and not too firm. There is a deck off your room, a nice place to sit and read or talk, have coffee, wine or a meal during good weather.

Guest access
You have your own private bedroom and bathroom. There is a deck off your room. You're welcome to use the kitchen and dining area.

I have Amazon Prime, Netflix, and a DVD player and some DVDs.

name: Sunny, spacious 2BR w/roof deck near Harvard and T
description:
Stay steps from public transport in a lovely historic neighborhood! This guest suite is on the 3rd floor of our elegant home in Porter Square. The whole floor is yours, including 2 bedrooms, private bath and private roof deck; we share only the entrance and stairway. We are surrounded by restaurants and shopping, and, as natives, have lots of tips! Microwave, fridge and coffee/tea in the suite. We are COVID vaccinated, speak German and French, and welcome all types of couples and families.

The space
The suite includes two lovely, sunny rooms, large bathroom with rain head shower and jetted tub, and private roof deck. There is French-press coffee, tea, a microwave and a small fridge available on the landing between the two bedrooms. The roof deck is perfect for morning coffee, restaurant take-out, or a glass of wine later in the day. We occupy the first two floors; you will share with us a gracious front entryway and the main stairway. Sheets and towels a
neighborhood_overview:
Lively, very safe neighborhood full of restaurants, shops, galleries and playgrounds. Harvard Yard and the Harvard museums and arts venues are nearby, as are Lesley , MIT and Tufts. Nearby Davis Square is a delight!
There are so many colleges in walking, bus and subway range that we are a popular two-bedroom choice for families' college visiting and graduations, for visiting academics and artists, and of course we love to welcome tourists to our beautiful native city!
host_about: I am a High School Teacher and Chaplain, married with three grown children.  My husband and I are relaxed and friendly, well-traveled and always respectful of where we are staying.  We are experienced Airbnb hosts, thrilled to be back to traveling and hosting now that we are vaccinated!

name: Spacious 1 BR, 1.5 bath. Central Sq
description:
Perfectly situated apartment in the heart of Cambridge, in Central Sq. Spacious 1 bedroom, 1.5 bathroom, kitchen, and large balcony with lots of light and views of Harvard. Located on the upper floor of a high rise building.

The space
Spacious 1 bedroom apartment (~800 sq. ft.), 1.5 bathroom apartment on the sunny top floor of a high rise building. Great balcony with views accessible from both the bedroom and living room. Large living room area with wi-fi, TV (basic cable channels and Blu-ray so you can log on to your Netflix or other streaming apps ), dining table, plenty of interesting books, and two futons. Large bedroom with full bathroom, and extra half-bath in the living room. Fully equipped kitchen with amenities for cooking (pots, pans, etc), and toaster oven, microwave, fridge, stove, drip coffee maker, etc. Air conditioning and heat are adjustable within the unit.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of Central Square, right on Massachusetts Ave. between Harvard and MIT. Walking distance from Harvard, MIT. A few blocks away from grocery stores (Whole Foods, H-Mart, Trader Joe’s a little further but walkable), as well as dozens of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, yoga studios, Harvard and MIT museums, etc. Beautiful view of Harvard University skyline. About a half-mile walk to the Charles River, where you can enjoy a nice walk or jog.
host_about: I am a research biologist. I love introducing people to this city, as well as exploring other places.

name: 3BR/3BA +3x Parking by Central Sq, Harvard & MIT
description:
Spacious, airy and bright 2nd floor 3 Bed/3 Bath Condo with onsite parking (3 spots available), located in the heart of Cambridge. We are just an 8 minute walk down the street to bustling Central Square, where you can get to either Harvard or MIT in 1 stop or downtown Boston (4 stops) in about 10 minutes.

Spectacular location, a 97 Walker Score with everything within walking distance. A wide variety of restaurants/bars/cafes/shops/Whole Foods/H Mart all within a short 5-10 minute walk.

The space
Location

Located in the heart of Cambridge, our condo is just 4 Blocks down the street from Central Square and T (Red Line) and 2 blocks from Inman Sq. The Red Line is one of the most convenient and quickest ways to get around the Cambridge and Boston areas. Uber/Lyft is also very easily accessible in the area.

Inman Sq - 0.2 Miles
Central Square - 0.4 Miles
MIT/Kendall - 0.7 Miles
Harvard - 0.8 Miles

name: One/Two BR near MIT/Kendall/Harvard
description:
Newly furnished apartment in modern elevator building with fully equipped kitchen. This is a traditional one bedroom apartment configuration; however the living room has lockable doors so it can become a fully private second bedroom. Walk to MIT, Kendall Square or Harvard. Parking may be available in our garage for an extra fee.

The space
This one bedroom unit features a living room that can be used as a second private bedroom. Complete flexibility for use by two or more roommates or as one whole apartment. The living room has a twin bed, along with a queen sofabed and desk. It can be separated from the kitchen/dining area by shutting (and locking) the barn-style doors. The master bedroom has a queen bed, a sofa and a desk. Note that some pictures and the 3D video were taken before the extra bed and desk were added (see captions for more detail).

Other things to note
There is a Keurig & regular coffee maker. A starter supply of paper
neighborhood_overview: Besides being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

Hello everyone, 
My name is Darko. I grew up in France and I now live in Massachusetts. I love to travel, to meet new people and to explore new countries and cultures.

name: sunny 2-level apt. near Harvard
description:
This cozy, sun-filled, family and pet-friendly apartment is in a Victorian house on a lovely, tree-lined street; 5 blocks to Harvard, 3 blocks to Lesley; close to Tufts. Four blocks to Red Line T station and easy access to downtown Boston, hospitals, MIT. One block to Mass. Ave with great restaurants, coffee houses, shops, bars.
Kitchenette, office area, large bedroom with skylights, reading nook, free wireless, cable, Netflix.
Off-street parking, and use of laundry and yard.

The space
You share the front entrance with onsite owners, but your apartment upstairs is completely private.
Enjoy your living room and kitchen area with refrigerator, cooktop, microwave, and convection toaster oven (no full oven), which are fine for cooking light meals. TV with free premium cable, WIFI, and Netflix are also included. Curl up in the sunny reading nook upstairs, work at the desk, or enjoy the big sky-lit bedroom. There is a table and chairs on the side
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is on a quiet tree-lined residential one-way street with attractive gardens, but 1 block from Mass. Ave, with lots of wonderful, varied restaurants, shops, coffee houses, and night clubs. It's a lively neighborhood. There are three markets within 4 blocks.
Great area for walking. Harvard and Lesley Universities, university life and grounds (Harvard Yard), museums, historic buildings, entertainment, are short walks away.
Medical facilities close by.
host_about:
My husband and I have lived in this house over 40 years.  We love our neighborhood and community.  We have two sons and 3 grandchildren - who live in New York City.
I am a sociologist, and have worked in employment and education research and program/policy development.  I am retired, on Board of community-based non-profit assisting low income young people of color build their futures.
I continue  to be involved in political and social policy development.  I like theater, dance, walking with our dog, and visiting with our grandkids, continuous learning, and traveling to interesting places.
My husband and I try to be great hosts - helpful but not intrusive.

The space
This apartment accommodates up to nine and is ideal for a family or group looking for a high quality extended stay. Simply yet elegantly furnished three bedroom with two full bathrooms (master bath has a large shower, other bathroom has a tub and washer/dryer). Pull-out queen-size sofabed and twin airbed. Gourmet kitchen fully equipped for cooking.

Bright and spacious renovated 2nd flr apt. Walk to Harvard or Porter sq, run at Reservoir, eat at gourmet shops or bakery close by. One block to Harvard Smithsonian, 15-20 min walk to Harvard square. Eat-in kitchen, dining room, renovated bath, comfy living room.

We welcome you and know you will be comfortable. This is a 2 bedroom one bath apartment. There is a queen bed in the master and two singles in the 2nd bedroom. name: Big, Bright, Private Room w Bath in luxury condo
description:
This really is an amazing place! The condo is beautiful and has a fully stocked kitchen, dining and living room. You'll have a spacious sunny bedroom w/tv and your own private full bath. Add-ons: free gym, use of w/d & office equipment.

I'd love to have you stay in my home. I live here with 2 fabulous, friendly cats who love guests. Please do not book this room if you don't like cats, are afraid of them, or are allergic to them. I look forward to meeting you! Ciao!!!

The space
It's perfect for a visiting scholar, businessperson on temporary assignment, medical professional or a student attending at schools in the area. You’ll have WiFi and cable tv, and full office facilities are also available if you need them. There is a tv, a big walk-in closet, and there are laundry facilities in the condo. A second bed, a pullout located in the living room, is available if you occasionally have visitors. It can sleep 3 children or 2 adults.

Gue
neighborhood_overview: This is a beautiful location in Cambridge. You’re just a few steps away from the scenic Charles River and its running and bike paths.  There’s a Whole Foods, a Trader Joe’s, a drugstore, 3 restaurants and a Microcenter (computer and office supplies) on this block, and Sculler’s Jazz Club is right across the river, a 10 minute walk in heels... and did I mention that the best lobster sandwich in Boston is just a block away.
host_about:
I’m an award- winning designer, singer and cook.  And, I'm open to people of all stripes... or polka dots, or color, or gender, or sexual preference. 
I'm a Jersey girl who came to Cambridge as a grad student and never left...  so I can help with local history, lore and information, dining and entertainment suggestions... and if I don’t know something, I know someone who does... and I can guide you to the best lobster sandwich in Boston, just a block away, courtesy of my friends Louie and Mario... and I love meeting new people, like you!

description:
This is a 2 bedroom condo that is on a quiet residential street only 2 blocks away from Harvard. It gives you central access to not only Cambridge, but Boston itself. It is spacious and easily accommodates up to six people.

The space
This is a great place for a group to treat as home as they visit the Cambridge and Boston areas. It is just a couple blocks from Harvard itself, but that also means it is close to Harvard square- an area of Cambridge with many shops, cafes, restaurants, and a subway stop that will take you straight into the center of Boston in exactly 14 minutes, with no need to change train lines.

You'll have:
-Fresh towels and linens
-High-quality toiletries for every guest
-High-speed wifi
-A fully equipped kitchen
-A Roku TV

Guest access
You'll have full and exclusive use of the whole condo.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a residential neighborhood just off the main street which has many local shops available to you. There is a nearby park for your enjoyment on sunny days. Overall, you'll have plenty to see, do, and eat during your stay all within walking distance.

This is a great base of operations for groups seeking to visit Harvard, MIT, or Tufts University.

name: Renovated 2BR apartment near MIT
description:
This two bedroom apartment in a modern building has a brand new kitchen and bathroom with a roll-in shower. It sleeps up to 6. High quality bedding. Master bedroom has a queen bed, second bedroom has a bunkbed (2 twins). Queen sofabed in living room. Short walk from Central Sq., MIT and Harvard. Enjoy gourmet kitchen and dining area.

The space
This apartment is ideal for a family or group that is looking for a high quality extended stay and can accomodate guests with wheelchairs. The master bedroom has queen bed and private bathroom. The second bedroom has a bunk bed (2 twins). We use only high quality Beautyrest mattresses so you will have a good night's sleep. A second shared bathroom with a roll-in shower also houses the full-size washer/dryer. The dining area can seat up to 6 while the living room features a 48 inch smart HDTV and a sofabed (with a firm, comfortable foam mattress). Cook in the gourmet kitchen instead of dining out.

Check out our
neighborhood_overview: Besides being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Urban Oasis near MIT & Harvard
description:
Newly renovated upscale one bedroom private apartment on first floor in a Central Square Cambridge 2 family house. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in Harvard Square in 2 minutes or Boston in 4 minutes.

The space
Rated by walkscore as a Walker's & Biker's Paradise with Excellent Transit, it is a perfect location for the car-free traveller! Vibrant city activity all around and yet, in the garden, you are within a little magic garden oasis.

Designed by a LEED-certified architect with an eye for natural light and an award-winning lighting designer, it gets its electricity through a 100% Green Renewable Energy program.

Guest access
Washer/dryer and patio/garden shared with the fully vaccinated owners who live upstairs from apartment.

Other things to note
Just a block away from top-rated restaurants, including The Dial and Little Donkey. Also, a block away is the Central Squar
neighborhood_overview:
We love Central Square for it's rich weave of diversity and culture, restaurants and nightlife, education and the creative and whimsical local merchants!

Don't know Central Square? Check out this Boston.com video on the Square: https://youtu.be/tKY42t03GMs
host_about:
My name is Carolyn and my husband, Bill, and I can greet you and give you the keys to the apartment when you arrive. We also provide a contactless check-in / stay option. Starting in 2010, we spent 3 years working with an architect, lighting designer, contractor and landscape designer to re-envision our home and to create an apartment on our first floor. Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment. 

One of the many joys of living in Central Square is that we walked to M.I.T. where we both worked in the IT department for many, many years. We retired in early 2018.

neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet, residential area but with convenient access to T, Davis, Square (15 min walk), Porter Square (5 min car or bike ride), 10 min subway ride to Harvard Square, 20 min to downtown Boston.
host_about:
IMPORTANT CORONA VIRUS UPDATE:
Self check-in/out will allow for social distancing here. 
As you can see in almost all of reviews from previous guests, we hold cleanliness to a high standard and clean apartment is our priority. 

To prevent the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), we have implemented a comprehensive cleaning and sanitizing protocol. This includes sanitizing tables, counters, door and cabinet knobs.

I’d like to also ask all guests to follow CDC and the Massachusetts Department of Health guidelines and recommended techniques and updates. 

Thank you so much for your understanding and cooperation.

I'm a musician. I was born in Poland but I have been living in Boston for the last 25 years. I travelled extensively all over Europe and some other places around the world. My favorite destinations include Southern France, Croatia, and Cape Cod. I love swimming, hiking, biking, reading, and listening to jazz and classical music.

name: Spacious Strawberry Hill Suite (West Cambridge)
description:
This suite is less than 2 miles west of Harvard Sq. You'll have exclusive access to the space, which has a full bathroom and kitchenette.

There is a queen bed suitable for two people and the couch in the living room converts to a bed for one.

Our neighborhood is friendly, safe, and has a lot to offer. Public transportation (bus) is a 5 minute walk. The trip to Harvard Square is 10-15 minutes.

I live in the home downstairs and am available should you need me during your stay.

The space
The suite is 5 rooms with private access on the third floor of our house.

As you enter, there is a living room with a TV and leather sleeper sofa and a middle room with a desk in case you need to get some work done.

The bedroom has a queen sized bed, charging station, and a dresser if you’d like to put your clothes away.

Our bathroom features the home's original claw-foot tub; I also stock the bathroom with toiletri
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Strawberry Hill, the smallest neighborhood in Cambridge, and very close to the borders of Watertown and Belmont, Mass. The house is approximately 2 miles west of Harvard Sq., which is easy to get to via public transportation. We’re also near Fresh Pond (about a 10-minute walk) which has lovely trails for walking, running, biking and more.
host_about:
I work in Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging practitioner and coordinate weddings in my spare time. 

My favorite thing to do on weekends is try new restaurants in Boston and Cambridge. Let me know if you want suggestions!

I try to go to as many live shows as I can. My favorite venues are: The Sinclair, Royale, and Paradise Rock Club.

Best shows I've been to: Feist (@ Berklee College of Music), Lady Gaga (@ Fenway Park), Miami Horror (@ the Sinclair), Shy Girls (@ Great Scott), Coldplay (@Xfinity Center)

Favorite travel destinations: Stockholm, Sweden; Erfurt, Germany; Cape Town, South Africa; Porto, Portugal, and Tokyo, Japan

Currently binge-ing on: Happy Endings, RuPaul's Drag Race, and Pose.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is at a prime location, close to Harvard, Central Square, Kendall Square, MIT, and downtown Boston. We are within reasonable walking distance to all major Cambridge neighborhoods and downtown Boston. There are also shops, bars, restaurants, grocery stores and pharmacy within walking distance, about 1 to 13 minute walk depending on where you want to go.

Depending on what you're hoping to do while in town, we are happy to make suggestions and help you have the best time possible when you visit.
host_about:
Hello, we are Yan’s hosting team. We are full-time property managers. Our hosting team is always happy to help so please don't hesitate to contact us anytime! :)

We love hosting people in Boston because it's an exciting city full of culture and history. In our free time, we like to go out with friends, travel, as well as enjoy all the fun activities that Boston has to offer. Our style of hosting is flexible because everyone's needs are different. We want to make your stay enjoyable and help you meet your goal of staying here. We look forward to hosting you! :)

neighborhood_overview:
We are in the heart of diverse Inman Square, Cambridge, Massachusetts. The neighborhood is wonderful, safe and has great energy, not to mention great night life and everything you need! There are many eateries, entertainment venues and sites to visit via walking or taking public transportation. The MBTA bus system is located just outside the door. Also, Uber, Zip Car, Lyft and Hubway Bike rentals are all accessible in Inman Square.
Boston's oldest, continuously operating improvisational theater troupe, ImprovBoston is located just around the corner on Prospect Street in nearby Central Square. ImprovBoston alumni include Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me! panelist Adam Felber.
Studio200 is in a convenient location with lots to see and do with its' many world class museums, colleges and restaurants. Visit Boston's little Italy, Chinatown or the theatre district where you can take in a movie or live play at the famous Wang Centre. See the Blue Man Group.

host_about:
I am a an entrepreneur in fashion and urban designer. 

My spouse is a biotech entrepreneur. We have two little precious children, two active but cute kids. My spouse, our kids, and I have traveled in the North, South, and Central America, Europe, Middle East, and Asia so far. We love to discover different cultures and meet people from these beautiful, lovely, and nice societies. 

We would be very much happy to host you in our lovely, warm, and friendly place which is disinfected and cleaned properly all the time. Please feel free to interact with us, share your experience, tell us your stories and be part of "the moment" that could give all of us a different point of view about each other, our wonderful planet, and life! 

We tend to give privacy to our guests, so feel free to let us know if you would like to get in touch in person. We are more than happy to say hi in person. 

You are more than welcome to be part of our neighborhood by following CDC's health requirements due to the COVID-19 pandemic, respectfully!

name: Quiet 2 Bedroom Apartment near MIT, BU & HBS
description:
Our private 2 bedroom apt. is in an antique home on a quiet street. In addition to the two air-conditioned bedrooms, it has a living room, kitchen/dining room and a full bath. 10 minute walk to Central Square 'T' station, BU bridge, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. WiFi. Due to recent city short-term rental regulations limiting homeowners to one apartment, we must have guests book our 2 bedroom apartment for 90+ days or longer. Please send a message to discuss making your dates work.

Guest access
After entering an exterior door and walking up on flight of stairs, guests have their own locked entrance to the private apartment. Guests have shared access to the side patio and yards, including a charcoal grill. Washer & dryer available in the cellar. On street parking. Great WiFi, too.

Other things to note
For your convenience, we have an MBTA 'Charlie Card' available. Fares on the reloadable plastic card are cheaper than those on the paper card.
host_about: We have lived in Cambridge MA for over 30 years. We love the New England area and embrace all four seasons as well as the food and activities that come with them. In addition to loving this area, we both like to travel as much as we can. After all the years in Cambridge, we still love to discover new restaurants and activities in the Boston area and are looking forward to sharing those places with you when you come to visit. Our apartment is close to farmers' markets, interesting bars and restaurants, and public transportation to go anywhere in Boston or Cambridge. We are a 10 minute walk to the Charles River and its hike and bike paths as well as several Hubway bike rental spots. We'll happily loan you helmets! You can walk to Harvard, MIT and BU from our central location and even downtown Boston is only a little over a 1/2 hour walk. There's so much to see and do in this historic and interesting neighborhood. Come visit!

name: Three-bedroom Harvard Square condo.
description:
1400 sf 3.5-bedroom condo two blocks from Harvard Yard. The entire top floor of a three-story house so you get light from all four sides. Seven minutes from the Harvard Square Red Line T station. Perfect set-up for a couple with kids. The downstairs unit, exactly half the size, sold in June 2017 for over $800k.

We use this mostly as an office so everything is set up well for working, including laser printer.

Well-behaved dogs welcome.

Condo docs require that we rent for at least one month.

The space
Although we use it as an office we try to keep it set up as though a family with two kids had just walked out the door. There is a full selection of toys for ages 3-7. There is also some stuff for a dog (we have a Golden Retriever).

Guest access
The whole condo is yours!

name: Prime location Harvard/Porter Sq
description:
Prime location between Harvard/Porter sq. King bed, en suite bathroom, offering good value for two people. Off street family home, quiet yet yards away from all the action. The room is mostly taken up by the bed. There is ample cupboard and drawer space for a longer stay, a wall mounted tv with cable and a white noise machine for sleeping, not that it’s noisy, I just noticed they’ve become popular.

The space
The house is eclectic, furnished with vintage furniture, and maybe a bit of a fixer upper by American standards but most people love it. The bed is quite low so perhaps not suitable for older people. The shower head is new but the bathtub is old, and has a few hard water stains by the tap. The room is not pitch black in the mornings, so some guests may like to bring an eye mask. I would also add that this is not a pristine secluded guest room but rather a comfortable rickety little room amidst a family home, would suit young informal people not too worried a

name: private studio near Harvard/MIT
description:
My place has everything you need for a comfortable, easy stay in Cambridge: a keyless entry to a completely separate studio space allows you to arrive anytime after 3, so no worries if you arrive on the late side. You''ll find a queen sized bed, microwave/fridge/coffeemaker, streaming TV, comfortable recliner and a desk chair for when you're working. We're walking distance from Kendal, Central, and Harvard Squares. On street parking in our neighborhood using our visitor pass, upon request.

The space
Your room has a private entrance, and a bathroom that was just remodeled. Our large, freshly painted room is set up as a studio, with a queen size bed, table and chairs, comfortable reclining chair, cable TV and Wifi. You have a fridge with freezer, microwave, toaster, Keurig coffee maker with coffee sugar and half and half provided, and an electric kettle with an assortment of teas; think hotel room with a couple of extras, not a full kitchen. Loads of clean to
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has a mix of younger professionals, families, and students. We're right next to a city park, 5 minutes from Central Square, and walking distance from Harvard Square and Kendal Square. Central Square has a big collection of restaurants, from alternative vegetarian to Indian, Chinese, the best sushi restaurant in Cambridge, and many more.
host_about: When I travel, I want to feel comfortable and at home wherever I'm visiting, as much like I"m living there as possible.  That's what we've created here: a comfortable little home smack in the middle of Cambridge, 5 minutes from the MBTA subway system, and a lovely walk to Harvard in one direction and MIT/Kendal Square in the other.
