name: 1 Bedroom in Kendall Square
description:
This is a great place that is close to everything. It is on the top floor of a three unit building in which you can see the edges of the Boston skyline in the distance.

This place has a comfortable bed, couch, and fully functional Roku TV.

You can get to the Kendall Square T stop within a 10 minute walk and there is plenty to eat and shop for at the Cambridgeside Galleria which is only 3 blocks away.

The space
This is a cozy one bedroom, but the sofa turns into another bed for a group of four just looking for a place to crash.

Guest access
Full access to the whole unit.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is the real value of this unit. It is close to the Red line and Green line, both of which will get you anywhere you want to go in Boston or Cambridge within just 15 minutes on the train. And each of these lines is only a 10 minute walk away.

Also, you'll have access to a large mall with plenty of shopping and food options available for you at the Cambridgeside Galleria.

Large 1 BR, separate work Den/Child's room | 1 BA condo features separate living room & dining room w/kitchen & stainless steel appliances, high ceilings, hardwood floors throughout. Condo has an incredible location in Harvard Square.


- 1 bedroom | 1 bath condo with a Study/Den that features a spacious living room with a brand-new kitchen and stainless steel appliances, high ceilings, hardwood floors throughout, air conditioning, and separated bedrooms, spread across 890 sqft.

- Located on the historic Harvard Square neighbo
neighborhood_overview:
Right across from the Harvard Law School and from the corner of Longy School of Music, 4 minute walk to Harvard Square, this is truly a vibrant neighborhood yet residential. You are close to everything you need to. We have cafe's (Starbucks and hi-rise), the famous falafel store- wrappro, Cambridge commons.

Harvard Square Redline is 5 to 6 minutes walk or less.

description:
Our place is convenient to Harvard, Tufts, Lesley MGH & MIT It is close to the RED Line "T" stations (Alewife + Davis) as well as the bus #77 stop. You’ll love our place because of the safe, quiet neighborhood, the comfy queen sized Kingsdown mattress with lots of fluffy pillows, a down comforter, a desk, a moon pod, and a skylight. In addition you will be helping two grandparents save money for flights to visit their grandchildren in Italy & Canada! NOTE: Please no dog allergies/phobias.

The space
The space is very quiet, bright, airy and cozy. Perfect for someone who is working on their thesis or just needs a good night sleep.

We live in a very quiet neighborhood on a dead-end street in North Cambridge.

host_about:
My name is Carla and my husband Steve and I live in Cambridge, MA.  We have three extra bedrooms that we have made available to those who have a business or educational need to be in Cambridge. We have four adult children and two of them live in other countries.  The Airbnb rentals provide us with the funds to visit them. 
We have two dogs, a Golden Retriever and a Yorkshire Terrier, so we only rent to people who are not afraid or allergic to dogs.  

We hope you will consider allow us to host your stay!
Carla, & Steve

name: Cambridge comfort.
description:
Update: Seeking short term, but with longer term ideal.

My place is a warm, spacious condo with 10 ft high ceilings and mostly hardwood floors throughout. Eat in kitchen with full laundry, dining room/study, and living room. 1.5 bathrooms. Near shopping and entertainment, and public transportation. Free off-street parking, rear deck and yard, and front porch. The room is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. It is also possible to bring a pet (message me if interested).

The space
This is classic "Triple Decker" or three family home that's over 100 years old converted to a condo and renovated, but has kept it's charm.

It's on a quite street but just around the corner from busy Mass Ave that will get you to Harvard, MIT, and Boston in minutes via a shady trail and a peacefull 10 minute walk to the Subway (the "T") (or one minute walk to bus 77.. The trail goes away from the city for 10 miles or so and is called the
neighborhood_overview:
My place is in North Cambridge and more residential. It's along the border with Somerville and close to Arlington. Century(s) old classic "Double/Triple Deckers" are common and young or youngish professionals, students and young families live in the mostly renovated homes.

Though quite, it's location is very close free live music nightly in Davis or Porter squares, and probably over 50 restaurants within walking distance.
host_about:
I'm new to Airbnb and wondering why I haven't hosted at my place before.  My work is in health care both clinical and in research regulation.  For fun I bike, hike, climb, play soccer, and take excursions both near and far when the opportunity arises.   
Favorite places are Seattle where I lived years, and Central and South America where I work/volunteer when possible.  Nearby, Davis Square,sailing in Boston Harbor, or road trips in New England top the list.  
I've mainly been a solo traveler and have skipped across the world at a rapid pace from hostel to hostel, now I'm looking for more focused trips and Airbnb seems to be the best answer for this.  
I have my first guest currently, and I look forward to many more in the future, and from all over the world.  
My dog is extremely friendly, quiet and would love the company as well.  We will consider travelers with pets.  
Happy traveling!

name: Harvard/MIT (Unit 1)- Brooklyn Ambiance w/ Parking
description:
Central Square is known for its diversity, upscale, ethnic eateries and a vibrant club scene. Easy walk to Central Square subway (3 min), MIT (12 min) and Harvard (15). Our apartment offers parking for 1 large car, and a well-equipped kitchen for entertaining.

The space
This apartment is located within walking distance of bars, restaurants, grocery (Whole Foods and H Mart) and the Central Square subway stop. Mitsubishi air cooling system was installed this year.

The apartment is located on the first floor, and includes kitchen essentials, coffee machine, microwave, gas stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, washer/dryer, TV (with cable) and WiFi.

Sleeping possibilities include:
- 1st bedroom: Double bed and en suite bathroom
- 2nd bedroom: Double bed and trundle mattress
- 3rd bedroom: Queen bed

Towels and bedding are included in the price. Baby cot is available upon request.

Guest access
G
neighborhood_overview: Central Sq. is hot!  Lots of great dining options.  Walking to either MIT or Harvard is very easy.  Cambridge is a bike friendly city.
host_about: I am an English teacher for new Americans own the two unit apartment building.    If unable to personally greet you, our two sons will be happy to assist you.  We live two miles away from this building.   We have developed an "insider's guide to Cambridge" to provide you with a solid foundation to enjoy your stay.  We frequently stay with Airbnb hosts when we travel.    I am member of two choirs and love history and literature.

name: Spacious 2BR 2 bath, walk to Harvard & MIT
description:
Welcome! This home is spacious and airy, with high ceilings and open floor plan. Charming, historic house with all modern amenities: central A/C, stainless steel appliances, Wi-fi, and washer/dryer in unit. Complimentary coffee & tea. Quiet, residential street, yet close to everything: 10 min walk to Harvard, 20-30 min walk to MIT, bus or T (subway) to Boston (25 min). WholeFoods, restaurants, and shops around the corner, with lots more within 5-15 mins walk. Parking by arrangement.

The space
This classic Cambridge house underwent an award-winning restoration in 2010. Historic on the outside, 'classic' modern on the inside, with all the comforts of a new home. Large, well-equipped kitchen with granite counters and stainless steel appliances opens up to large dining and living room. 2 bathrooms: one with full bath tub and marble vanity top, and another with oversized shower. Bright rear bedroom has queen bed, dresser, big closet, and opens onto a large private
neighborhood_overview: We're on a  tree-lined, quiet, residential street with brick sidewalks and charming 100-year old wood houses, but walking distance to everything. Around the corner are several restaurants and cafés: Dali's (tapas), Kebob factory (Indian), Bergamot (American / fusion), The Thirsty Scholar Pub, Darwin's (sandwiches and baked goods - yum!) and the Biscuit (bakery and café). If you want to eat in,  get stuff around the corner at Wholefoods, The Wine and Cheese Cask, and Savenor's the butcher. A short walk away are lots more shops, restaurants and night life in Inman Square (5min), Harvard Square (10-15 min) and Union Square (5-10min). Harvard Art Museums 10 min, public library and pool 3-5 min walk.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kjersti, (yup, unusual name unless you're Norwegian - so I also answer to Kirsti or just K:).  I love to travel to places a bit off the beaten path. Closer to home I enjoy my kids, skiing, hiking, biking, Kung Fu, cooking, and spending time with  family and friends.  Looking forward to hearing from you! 
Best, 
Kjersti

name: Cambridge in Harvard Square - a spacious home.
description:
Located in Harvard Square, the house is minutes away from the main Harvard campus,Harvard Law, Harvard Business School, and MIT. The two bedroom home has two large living rooms with books and original art and Donghia furniture. Note: the sofas are not for sleeping). One can walk out front door to reach two excellent cafe's or visit the Harvard Art Museum to see a Van Gogh or Cezanne or have a fabulous meal. All of this is possible within minutes of easy walking.

The space
This tastefully furnished two bedroom Arts and Crafts home has two large living areas, an eat-in kitchen, a washer and dryer and a private garden. There are two desks for working and 3 TV's with cable service that includes all the premium channels and wifi. There are windows on all four sides and views of Riverbend park and the Charles River.

Guest access
Guests will have sole access to the entire first floor of our two family home. Guests will control their own h
neighborhood_overview: Mount Auburn Street is a tree lined street with an eclectic array of local gardens lining the sidewalk.  The neighborhood is part of the Half Crown Marsh Conservation District with mostly Victorian architecture    The house is four doors away from Longfellow Park - designed by Charles Elliot in 1887.  Across the street is Riverbend Park where you can sit on a bench and watch the Charles River where rowing teams from the various universities often practice.  We have two cafes in the neighborhood. Darwins and Flour both very good and both close. Memorial Drive which runs alongside the Charles River ( a short block from our house) is closed for biking, roller skating etc. from 11am to 7pm on Sundays from the last Sunday in April until the 2nd Sunday in November.  Because of major universities located in Cambridge, the city is very international and you will hear many different languages spoken

name: Convenient & Comfortable (3K)
description:
Our place is close to MIT, Harvard, Landmark Theaters Kendall Square Cinema, public transport, supermarket, and a lot more...

This room is great for couples, solo adventurers, academics/scholars, business travelers, researchers, and anyone with wanderlust.

With a desk and a monitor to get some work done!

Daily parking pass is available at $5 per day.

The space
This room is a bedroom in a 3-bedroom apartment. It is a medium-sized room with a desk, chair, closet, and, of course, a bed. The water pressure in the bathroom is great.

The room is right next to the kitchen, so you may hear us as we hang out, cook, chat, etc. Naturally, you are welcome to join! Or, if you would like it to be quiet, just let me know and we can move into the living room or to the kitchen on the 2nd floor.

Guest access
You will have access to:
- your room (exclusive)
- living room
- kitchen
- bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a unique blend of corporate, academic, and artistic.  You are next to a great food, a park, a pool hall, and way too many places to list ranging from foodie to Toscanini's ice cream (a landmark) to Flat Top (pool hall) to Kendall Square [indy] Theatre, and so on...  Easy access to MIT, Harvard and the plethora of corporations, while right across the river from downtown Boston (Massachusetts General Hospital, Beacon Hill, etc.).

description:
*Please send inquiry, not request!

Quiet, comfortable 1 bedroom perfect for solo adventurers, couples, business, or families. Walk to MIT or Harvard. Beautiful, safe Inman Square neighborhood--a true gem!

-Exclusive use of entire, newly renovated apartment
-Easy 24 hour keyless entry
-6 min walk to train!
-15 min walk to Harvard or MIT
-Private street in safe, quiet neighborhood
-2 min walk to great food/grocery
-Luxury memory foam mattress & linens
-New kitchen with coffee bar
-Free laundry

The space
*I'm a Superhost! Please see my 5 star reviews for other apartments. Expect to have a wonderful stay :)

Exclusive use of a newly renovated, entire 1 bedroom apartment in a historic Cambridge brick.

This lower level apartment is bright and clean. The open living room and kitchen are perfect for hanging out or relaxing. The new bathroom with custom marble is located between the be
neighborhood_overview:
It's quiet, charming, and only 5 minutes from the train! My neighborhood is a safe oasis of fabulous food and cute shops.

Harvard is a 15 minute walk. There you can enjoy Harvard Square, tour Harvard campus, explore historical points of interest, visit Harvard's art museums, see American historical sights, and enjoy coffee while people-watching.

Central Square is a 6 minute walk (there is a train stop there.) At Central, you'll find quirky dive bars, a cool used book store, juice bar, vegan/ vegetarian/farm-to-table restaurants, live music, record shops, thrift shops, yoga, and art galleries.

MIT is a 15 minute walk. You can take a guided tour and enjoy the MIT Museum, free interactive public art, and gardens.

A Hubway bike station is a 5 minute walk.

Inman Square is a 2 minute walk. There you'll find:
City Girl Cafe- phenomenal brunch & dinners in eclectic tiny restaurant
Punjabi Dhaba- award-winning Indian "street food
host_about:
Gleeful epicurean and traveler, always planning or returning from a trip.

Polyglot—I studied Swahili, Portuguese, Spanish, French, and Latin. I explore street markets until they close or kick me out. Can't live without passport, antique books, botany, kids & dogs, dinner club, gelato...

I mentor startups at Harvard and work in finance. 

Hosting is a blast; I give guests privacy, but I'm always available to help or make recommendations. I treat guests like fam and surprise them with treats. 

Everyone is welcome!

name: Sunny 1 bedroom condo close to Harvard/MIT
description:
Quiet and cozy one bedroom condo close to Harvard, MIT, and Inman Square! Recently renovated in a historic Victorian building, it features an updated kitchen and bathrooms, in-unit washer/dryer, and all of the comforts of home. We hope you can use our place as a launching pad for exploring Boston and Cambridge!

There is not parking available as part of this listing.

The space
This condo is perfect for two guests with a queen bed in the bedroom. There are 1.5 bathrooms, a washer and dryer in the unit, a full kitchen, and living room.

We will have plenty of fresh linens and towels for your stay. Make yourself at home!

We recently added a stationary bike to the living room...please feel free to use it! We will also leave you a yoga mat.

There is not parking available as part of this listing.

City of Cambridge Permit #CDR37301.

Guest access
The full apartment

Other things to n
neighborhood_overview: Inman Square is convenient to everything! Just a 10 minute walk to Central Square where there's lots of shopping and restaurants, plus easy access to the MBTA red line stop at Central Square. Just a block or two away from the apartment are tons of restaurants and coffee shops, making it easy to try all of the delicious cuisine in the area! We are also located in between two Whole Foods, and just two blocks away from a Walgreens. We love living here because it's so easy to get around. Central Square is a 10 minute walk, Harvard and MIT both take about 20-25 minutes to walk, or there are a number of bus lines running all over Boston just a block away!
host_about:
Hi! We are Steph and Ken. We love being active and trying new things. Some of our favorite things are the performing arts, working out, the beach, Disney trips, and meeting new people. Travel is awesome and I've been to Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, London, Paris, Berlin, Sydney, Bali and a few other fun places.

We are clean and respectful, and will treat your home like our own.

name: West Cambridge 1 BR entire apartment near Harvard
description:
Ground floor fully furnished one-bedroom apartment all to yourself near Harvard. Double bed walk-in closet. Living room. Dining room, study with desk, kitchen appliances & utensils. Back porch. Your own key.

Sheets towels Cable TV included.
WiFi
Window-mount AC.

Short bus ride or bike to Harvard Square.
Parking on street, 1 guest permit available to borrow.
Cambridge STR Certificate STR-17697

Sorry, no pets.

Booking is set to accept Minimum 1-month stays, but feel free to make inquiry.

The space
Apartment is in a three story 1909 era wooden building typical of Boston area, on residential street in western part of Cambridge (Fresh Pond/Strawberry Hill district) on the Cambridge-Belmont-Watertown line.

Apartments has its own seperate front and back door, leading to a common hallway and common doors front and back. There are a total of 3 other people in the building in addition to your
neighborhood_overview:
Short residential street connects to a Main Street with bus stop around the corner (Boston MBTA Bus Route 73, look it up on the Internet. Our Stop location is Sullivan Road).

Local pub, Chinese-Taiwanese restaurant, three coffee shops, ethnic deli, convenience store and large supermarket within walking distance.

The local supermarket has an in-house Starbucks, florist, pharmacy and service desk for FedEx packages and Western Union money transfers. BlueBikes bicycle rental outside the supermarket.

Other locations with half mile to a mile with more shops in Watertown's Coolidge Square (*), ATM, restaurants, Post Office, CVS Pharmacy/Store, Dunkin Donuts, two pizza eateries in walkable Watertown Coolidge Square area, site of famous 1947 era Watertown Deluxe Diner and a small but locally famous sub shop Emilio's. You must try an Emilio's meatball sub!

Also in Coolidge Square (*) Locally famous Red Lentil Vegetarian & Vegan Restaurant is here.
host_about: After retiring from hi-tech and telecommunications industry I have commenced a new career path as an amateur historian and independent scholar. To pay the bills, my spouse and I rent out on AirBnb and do some part time history teaching at local adult education centers in Cambridge and Brookline, Massachusetts. The occasional telecommunications consulting and research project still comes my way.  Part of my old job was travelling and meeting different people. My past business travels have taken me repeatedly all over the US, a lot of trips to France, Germany and the UK. Through AirBnB that can happen again, but in a different way!  Since I was born in Melbourne, Australia, we revisit there and we do stop by in New Zealand many times too. We have hosted or rented to people from all over the US, France, Sweden, Israel, China, Saudi Arabia,  Chile, Australia, Germany, Turkey, Lebanon & Taiwan.

name: Private, quiet and clean studio in ideal location
description:
Come discover historic Boston and Cambridge while staying in our comfy & private studio. Located in the heart of Cambridge, the studio is steps away from Lesley, Harvard and Harvard Law. Upon renting you will have available WIFI, room to sleep 4, a kitchen, bathroom and laundry room accessibility. Pull out full-size sofa!Walking distance from Harvard and Porter square. Train and bus transportation just minutes away. Great place for solo travelers, couples, small families and even students!

The space
The location of this studio is phenomenal! Minutes away from the best universities in the city, best eateries and shops. The studio is also located in a very quiet apartment building where you will be able to focus on your work or catch up on some much needed rest. The entire studio will be yours for your stay. This is NOT a shared unit. The apartment is freshly painted, very clean and decorated with all the essentials to make your stay no matter how long or short,
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location. This studio is smack in the middle of Harvard Square and Porter Square, two squares that are full of life and exciting things to see. I love the real city feel the studio and surrounding area has to offer. I love that the studio is Walking distance from eateries, parks and historic places. Cambridge is a diverse neighborhood, that is warm, friendly, and accepting. It is a great place to come learn and also vacation!
host_about:
Hi, 
My name is Cinzia. I am new to Airbnb, but have had a lot of experience traveling to many parts of the world thanks to my parents. I love learning about new cultures and meeting new people. I hope my place can be your home away from home for a short period of time. I am always just a call or text away if you ever need anything as a guest! I look forward to being your host.

name: 2020 Grad Student or Professor!
description:
Spend time in our artistic, sunny home near colleges and subway. Your room is quiet and private, a peaceful, clean spot to land w/ new Sealy Posturpedic Full-sized mattress. Tree-lined street in perfect neighborhood near Davis, Porter, Alewife. Very close to public transportation: Harvard, Tufts & Lesley all in walking distance, & easily accessible by bike, subway, bus. Great pup who loves our guests.

The space
Best if you understand and like rescue mutts. Callie is wonderful and needs to be petted when you come into the house (each time if she hears you!). As you will see she truly loves guests.

Guest access
Use of hot water heater for making coffee or tea in the morning. We ask that people don't cook in the kitchen at all. We can leave room in the fridge for a few food or drink items.

Other things to note
**please be vaccinated against Covid to prevent the spread.

1) Kitchen: We have not Re-opened use
neighborhood_overview: Fantastic Cambridge neighborhood! Near all public transportation, very short walk to Davis, Porter, Alewife and about a 20-25 minute walk to Harvard University or Tufts. Lesley is even closer. Parks, bike-path, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, shops, music bars, restaurants are all within walking distance. The court is quiet and friendly.
host_about:
Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well for a native NY'er (I've been here since graduate school which was over 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

A few notes & rules to help you decide if this is a good landing spot!
1) Bedroom doors do not have a locks on them
2) Best if you feel relaxed and affectionate with rescue dogs: (She won't be here if you rent the entire condo)
3) Please keep tidy; throw out your trash and recycling—at least every other day
4) Condo kitchen: Available for use only if you rent the entire condo; studio room has a kitchenette but the other airbnb rooms do not
5)  Please strip bed and open windows at check out
6) Cannot store luggage pre-arrival or post check -out
7) No smoking anything/anywhere on the property or outside on the court: Rule is enforced as per the request of our neighbors. 
8) Please be vaccinated against covid and updated with booster for variants of the virus for your own and our protection; thank you ! 

My son (now a young man) is also helpful with guests. My new dog, Callie,  is one of the sweetest mutts ever...She's a rescue and still a puppy so it's best if you like and understand dogs. She will not be here if you are renting the entire condo, of course :) She's a gem and needs a little petting initially in order to settle down around new guests! She will definitely bark a tiny bit when you come & go. Small children live upstairs so at times you will hear them running around; they are adorable and sweet!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS of "gobus" leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house at Alewife in Cambridge.

name: Spacious 1 Bedroom w/ Free Parking Near MIT
description:
This is a well laid out, spacious 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment that is ideal for a professional visiting the area on a long trip and looking for the necessary space to feel at home.

Unit requires month long stay. ID must be submitted prior to arrival.

The space
This space is very conveniently located within the city and is on a very quiet residential street. But it is an older unit and building that has not been renovated in a long time. So please expect an older building and the corresponding older feel that creates- like scuff marks here or there on the sink, walls, rugs, etc. Everything is 100% clean and functional, but they show their age visually.

Other things to note
Free parking! (Super rare in Cambridge). But please see notes about parking if you intend to use parking.

name: Sunny, quiet, large Cambridge apt near Davis Sq
description:
We're re-listing our beautiful apartment after a lengthy Covid break.
Comfortable and quiet very large apartment with a Scandinavian interior feel. 2 generous bedrooms with three beds. Around 1200 sf. 5 minute walk to Davis Square, Red Line, restaurants and shops. Location, location!

The space
The 1200sf apartment is on the first level. One bedroom has a queen bed, the other bedroom has two single beds.
Kitchen is open floor plan to dining room. Large white-oak table with 6 chairs. Relaxing living room area with couch and TV/wifi. Front screened-in porch with cork flooring is for relaxing and reading.
This apartment is ideal for visiting faculty or families wanting to get to know the area.

There is a washer and coin operated dryer in the basement shared with the host family for guests staying more than 4 nights.

Guest access
On street parking pass or parking in the driveway for one car available.

Li
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on the second floor of a multi-family home and is located minutes away to Davis Sq in a quiet, safe tree-lined street off the beaten path. Pemberton Farms, a popular local grocery store and numerous fantastic restaurants and cafés are in the area. Movie Theater, live music venues and shops - all in walking distance. Red line subway and convenient buses to Harvard, Tufts, MIT etc bike path and Danehy park close by. Children's playground just down the road.

name: Beautiful Cambridge/Harvard house
description:
Steps from Harvard campus, Harvard Yard and Harvard square. Close to public transportation, restaurants and shops. Newly renovated large house of 1700 sq feet: quiet, bright, high ceiling, nicely decorated with antique furniture and art. Private Parking spot.
A/C. Fully equipped eat in kitchen.
2 large Bedrooms, 1 smaller room with twin size bed (1 person), 2.5 bathrooms, living room with dining area. Ideal for 3-5 guests.
Garden and patio, outdoor dining table and chairs. BBQ. Washer/Dryer.

Nice antique furniture and art objects. Full of natural light, quiet. Ideal for a family and for longer stays. Outdoor space and dining space. Fully equipped kitchen. New bathrooms. Washer and Dryer. Enjoy the garden in the summer and the gas fireplace in the winter.
1st floor: Living room, dining area, eat in kitchen, 1/2 bathroom
2nd floor: one bright bedroom one smaller room, and a full large bathroom on the floor.

name: Penthouse Room With Private Entrance
description:
Top floor, steps from Porter Square and Red Line Subway.

Bed linens and towels provided.

There is a kitchenette with microwave, cooktop, refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster, pots, pans and dinnerware.

The house is a few steps away from Porter Square which has a grocery store, book store, coffee shop, restaurants and red line subway.

The space
The room is located on the top floor of a multifamily house. It has a private entrance and a large outdoor deck. The kitchenette has an induction cooktop, microwave and refrigerator. Large skylights makes the room bright and beautiful.

Guest access
You’ll have the entire 3rd floor to yourself including a rooftop deck. Laundry is in the basement. The room has a private entrance.
neighborhood_overview: The house is about a three minute walk from Porter Square subway station on the Red Line. The Red Line takes you to downtown Boston in less than 20 minutes. Harvard Square is about a 20-minute walk or one stop on the Red Line. Davis Square is about a 10-minute walk or one stop on the Red Line. Porter Square Shopping Center is only a couple of minutes from the house. The shopping center has a grocery store and a pharmacy open 24/7. There are also a coffee shop, a bookstore and several restaurants.

name: Walk to Harvard/MIT (unit 2) w/ parking
description:
Newly renovated three bedroom, two bath apartment in Cambridge. Easy walk to the Central Square metro (3 min), MIT (12 min) and Harvard (12 min). Parking for 1 large car. This apartment can accommodate up to 7 people. Our 1st floor unit was such a success that we have transformed the second floor unit for larger parties.

The space
This apartment is on the second and third floors of our building, and includes kitchen essentials, coffee machine, microwave, gas stove, refrigerator, washer/dryer, TV (with cable) and WiFi.

The apartment is located within walking distance of bars, restaurants, grocery (Whole Foods and H Mart), and the Central Square subway station.

Sleeping possibilities include:
- 1st bedroom: Double bed
- 2nd bedroom: Queen bed
- 3rd bedroom: Queen bed, Futon sofa
- Third fl annex: Twin bed

Towels and bedding are included in the price. Baby cot is available upon request.

Guest
neighborhood_overview: If you like Brooklyn, NY, you will love Central Square.
host_about: I am an English teacher for new Americans own the two unit apartment building.    If unable to personally greet you, our two sons will be happy to assist you.  We live two miles away from this building.   We have developed an "insider's guide to Cambridge" to provide you with a solid foundation to enjoy your stay.  We frequently stay with Airbnb hosts when we travel.    I am member of two choirs and love history and literature.

name: ^10min walk-Harvard, Suite-like/private entry/3fl
description:
Anchor Room
Huge 24'x11' 3rd floor room in our 19th c. victorian home. Unusual windows and gabled ceilings give the room tons of character! Air Purifier, queen sized bed, cozy living area with AC, couch, tv, mini fridge and microwave. Professionally cleaned. Parking by arrangement only.

Great location- 7min walk to the Porter Square subway, 10min walk to Harvard. Shops, restaurants, etc half block away on Mass Ave. The neighborhood is diverse and vibrant, and our street is quiet and safe!

The space
Our rental is not suitable for children or pets. Street parking only available by prior arrangement. The room, bathrooms, and common areas are professionally cleaned between guests.

The room is one of two we rent on the 3rd floor of our house, while we live on the first two floors. This 260/sf giant room is basically a suite- a sleeping area with a brand new queen bed with 100% cotton sheets, and a sitting area with couch, chair, and tv. The
neighborhood_overview:
One of the best neighborhoods in Cambridge! We're close to everything. The subway is right up the street. Historic Harvard Square is a 10-15 min walk with the University, historic sites, great food, shopping, and bustling street life.
We're just half a block away from Mass Ave, which stretches between Harvard and Porter Square and is lined with cute shops, cafes, restaurants, etc.

Our corner of the neighborhood is diverse and family oriented, with a sprinkle of students thrown in.
host_about:
Hi!

We are a married couple living in a big beautiful house in Cambridge. Jarrod is a scientist and Rae is a painter. We're pretty low key- when we're not working hard, we like to relax at home, explore local history, or check out antique shops.

We're friendly and are happy to be helpful in any way possible, but mostly keep to ourselves. Since our rooms to rent are separated from our living space, we might not encounter our guests at all, but are always available to answer questions.

name: Charming bed & private bath near Harvard, MIT&MBTA
description:
Walking distance to Harvard, Central Square, & MIT, this brightly lit bedroom with sparkling clean private bath is on a quiet tree-lined street in the heart of Cambridge. Steps from great food in Inman Square and convenient to MBTA & Blue Bike stand for transportation to Boston, Somerville, and beyond, this is the perfect location for business or pleasure. With windows and skylights to provide fresh air, your room comes complete with a coffee maker, a small refrigerator, and WIFI.

The space
A sun filled room with sky light, freshly ironed 100% cotton linens, and room to spread out. There is space in the dresser and closet to unpack, making a longer stay comfortable.

A Keurig coffee maker is stocked with coffee, tea, and hot chocolate pods. The mini-refrigerator comes stocked with fresh fruit, seltzer, juice, and milk for your coffee. Trail mix, granola bars, and chocolates will help with middle of the night or early morning munchies.
neighborhood_overview: A a quiet tree-lined street with the longest standing annual block party in Cambridge, the neighbors are friendly.  We are steps away from great places to eat in Inman Square and an easy walk to Harvard, Central, and Kendall Squares in Cambridge and Union Square in Somerville.
host_about: I work for an Episcopal church and volunteer with non-profit performing arts organisations. I live with my husband, a lecturer at Boston University, and one elderly cat.  We love our sunny home on our tree lined street in Cambridge.  I love to sing in my 3 choirs and am an avid skier and a lover of all things Austrian.

name: Classic Cambridge Victorian near Harvard, Lesley
description:
Classic Cambridge Victorian in beautiful, convenient neighborhood.

The space
Beautiful, spacious apartment in a classic 1896 Cambridge Victorian house with timeless charm--10ft ceilings, original egg and dart moldings, turret, hardwood floors, furnished to a high standard with pieces from Design Within Reach, Crate and Barrel, West Elm, and more. The apartment has a large main bedroom with beautiful dado paneling and a sunny second bedroom with West Elm mid-century modern desk and DWR chair; a fully equipped, eat-in kitchen; living room with dining area; half bathroom; and full bathroom with shower/tub combo. Officially registered with the City of Cambridge (Registration #STR-13547) and Massachusetts Department of Revenue (Certificate #C0086970491).

Guest access
Guests will have full, private use of the apartment. Front porch and patio shared with hosts.

Other things to note
You will receive an access code that will
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in beautiful Avon Hill, a historic residential neighborhood near the Porter Square T station, close to all Cambridge has to offer! Harvard Law School, Harvard University, Lesley University, grocery stores, coffee shops, and restaurants are all just a short walk away. We are also convenient to Tufts, and MIT Universities. We live in the apartment upstairs and absolutely love the house and this neighborhood!
host_about: We are a busy couple who work in healthcare and the arts, but we love to travel and always make time for getaways. We are transplants to Cambridge from England and Hawaii, who love living in this vibrant and welcoming city. There's always something interesting happening here!

neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street.
Whole Foods (with wine and beer) is a 5-minute walk; the Charles River (with walking and biking paths) is a 3-minute walk.
This is a diverse and convenient neighborhood.

Estabrook Room
Huge 23'x11' 3rd floor room in our 19th c. victorian home. Gabled ceilings give the room tons of character! Air Purifier, AC, comfy queen sized bed, and living area with couch, tv, mini fridge and microwave. Professionally cleaned. Parking by arrangement only.

Great location- 7 min walk to the Porter Square subway, 10 min walk to Harvard. Shops, restaurants, and bars half a block away on Mass Ave. The neighborhood is diverse and vibrant, and our street is quiet and very safe!

The space
Our space is not suitable for children or pets, and parking is by prior arrangement only. The room, bathrooms, and common areas are professionally cleaned between guests.

The room is one of two we rent on the 3rd floor of our house, while we live on the first two floors. This 250/sf giant room is basically a suite- a sleeping area with a brand new queen bed with 100% cotton sheets, and a sitting area with couch, chair, and tv. The room has
neighborhood_overview: One of the best neighborhoods in Cambridge! We're close to everything. The subway is right up the street. Historic Harvard Square is a 10-15 min walk with the University, historic sites, great food, shopping, and bustling street life. We're just half a block away from Mass Ave, which stretches between Harvard and Porter Square and is lined with cute shops, cafes, restaurants, etc. Our corner of the neighborhood is diverse and family oriented, with a sprinkle of students thrown in.
host_about:
Hi!

We are a married couple living in a big beautiful house in Cambridge. Jarrod is a scientist and Rae is a painter. We're pretty low key- when we're not working hard, we like to relax at home, explore local history, or check out antique shops.

We're friendly and are happy to be helpful in any way possible, but mostly keep to ourselves. Since our rooms to rent are separated from our living space, we might not encounter our guests at all, but are always available to answer questions.

name: Casa Paradiso - Top Floor 1bed/1bath in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to my Cambridge home with the vibe of Havana! I'd love to share my sunny, professionally-designed 1 bed/1 bath with you. Please treat it with kind and respect, as I would for you and yours.

With a walking score of 93, we're in a bustling neighborhood of great restaurants, coffee shops, craft beer pubs, and supermarkets. You can access Boston from Lechmere (Green), or Harvard Sq via the 69 bus, or bike/walk to Kendall Sq and Central Sq (Red).

The space
Ok, so here we go.
+Top floor apartment with views of the Prudential and beautiful sunsets (gotta walk up 4 floors to get to it, unfortunately no elevators. Some have commented that at least one of the staircases is a little narrow. It's worth it.)
+You got the entire place to yourself!
+In-unit laundry
+Super fast WiFi (Starry is awesome)
+Cozy at 500 sq ft. No, wait, excuse me. 505. :)
+Lots of sunshine
+Super comfy queen sized bed with fluffy down comforter
neighborhood_overview:
+Across the street is the public library, which I love to go and read or do work
+Right outside is a Little Free Library book exchange. It's an adorable place where you can take and leave books. Feel free to grab some or leave some!
+A few doors down is a bakery with the most amazing Portuguese bread I have ever tasted. I get some once a week.
+A few blocks down is a local butcher shop where I get fresh eggs and meats. If there are some in the fridge during your stay, you're more than welcome to them!
+There's a park and community pool across the street, which is fun in the summers to watch people play softball, or sit on the grass and read a book
+One of my favorite places to eat is Puritan & Company, which serves a modern twist to traditional New England cuisine
+If you're craving Tacos, there is a fab spot called the Lone Star Taco Bar. 4.5 stars, almost 900 reviews. Just saying.
+Usually known for their live music, or just a casual drink at a lo

name: Cambridge Executive Suites
description:
A modern, comfortable, sun-lit Executive Suite with all the necessary amenities for a business traveller.

The 550 sq. ft. suite includes a kitchen with appliances, utensils and supplies. A comfortable bedroom, with a charming view over Linear Park, bathroom and equipped work/lounge space.

The suite is well connected; just a 5 min. walk from the vibrant Davis Square. It's ideal for Guests visiting Tufts/Harvard/MIT for example. Any destination in metropolitan Boston can be reached in 25 mins.

The space
The Executive Suite is in a recently constructed condominium in North Cambridge. The suite is on the second floor, at the rear of the building, where Guests will enjoy a quiet stay, with charming views over Linear Park.

The building is certified energy efficient and fitted with modern equipment; the space is very comfortable to inhabit.

The suite is well lit by sunlight in the day, and has many lighting options in the even
neighborhood_overview:
The suite is located in North Cambridge, near the hip and vibrant Davis Square, Somerville, just a 5 min. walk away along Linear Park. Linear Park is a charming well lit pathway that is well trafficked day and night by folks day and night, walking back and forth to Davis Square, often with street music performers at points along the way.

Davis Square is certainly a cultural location, with shows and movies to see at the Somerville Theatre, in addition to Somerville Open Studios, ArtBeat, HONK! to name but a few of the many festivals the occur in the town around the year.

Davis Square is also a dining destination. There's something for everyone in these blocks, from barbecue to vegan fare. One can find the cuisines of Mexico, Italy, China, India, Japan, and more. And there are new places to find delicious food opening all the time.

And for nightlife, there are no shortage of bars, from the casual to the hip and trendy with fine beverages and food on offer
host_about:
I am part of a three person team. I have an two adorable children, Amber and Aiden.

I am the founder of a real estate tech company, and previously worked as a Structural Engineer on the design of skyscrapers.

I love to travel when I can, and have already visited many countries. But there are plenty of places left to explore, and enjoy again.

I am principally on airbnb to host. But who knows, on my next vacation I may also stay at someone's airbnb in an exotic location.

neighborhood_overview: This community is located in Kendall Square which has become one of the most exciting places to visit with endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.     CambridgeSide Galleria Mall  0.6 miles  Massachusetts Institute of Technology  0.4 miles  Harvard University  1.9 miles  Harvard Museum of Natural History  2.2 miles  Cambridge Common 2.5 miles
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Serene, Roomy 2BR near Harvard & Davis Sq
description:
Enjoy the peaceful tree views from this tastefully furnished, sun-splashed apt in Cambridge! Located on a quiet cul-de-sac, this peaceful 2nd floor apt is a short walk from vibrant shopping centers Porter Sq and Davis Sq (1 subway stop from Harvard Sq). Driveway parking for 1-2 cars avail for extra $100/mo.

STAYS OF 30+ NIGHTS ONLY. NO TAXES FOR 32+ DAY STAYS

The space
The living/ dining room is spacious with stately windows and wide views. The renovated kitchen has everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals, including pots, pans, toaster, microwave, electric kettle, French press, gas stove and electric oven. The main bedroom's queen size bed sleeps 2 people. The room has a writing desk to enable quiet working off the living room. A toddler bed is available on request. The second bedroom has a full size bed for 1 or 2 people. WiFi internet and cable TV are included. The modern bathroom with full-size tub will enable you to relax after a full day o
neighborhood_overview:
Porter Square area is a happening neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops, and grocery stores. Our apartment is a short walk to the Porter Sq subway stop on the Red Line. Harvard Square can be reached in 10 minutes by train (1 stop), or 20 minutes by foot past the colorful shops of Massachusetts Ave. Stay on the train past Harvard and arrive in downtown Boston in 10 minutes or so. Enjoy the beautiful views of the Charles River along the way!

Nearby Porter Square offers a variety of shops including a supermarket, drug store, toy shop, a gift shop that sells wares made by local artists, and a well-visited independent book store (with great coffee!) that frequently hosts talks by notable authors. There's even a new Target a short walk away. Within 2 blocks of the house there are 2 fantastic, highly rated restaurants (Cuban, French), an eclectic neighborhood restaurant/bar, and right at the end of the street is a beloved sports bar that's been in the neighborhood fo
host_about: Hi, I'm Cheryl. I love dancing, playing violin, challenging myself, and trying new things with friends. (Boston is a great place for trying new things!) I meditate regularly and try to live every day according to my values.

name: Luxurious 3Bdr Apartment near Fresh Pond
description:
Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short or long term visit.

The space
This apartment accommodates up to six and is ideal for a family or group looking for a high quality extended stay. Simply yet elegantly furnished three bedroom with two full bathrooms (master bath has a large shower, other bathroom has a tub and washer/dryer). Gourmet kitchen fully equipped for cooking.

Guest access
Apartment is on the third floor of a three story apartment building. To access the apartment, guests climb two flights of stairs. One parking space included.

Other things to note
A starter supply of paper goods, detergent, soap, shampoo etc. is provided. Vacuum, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and cleaning supplies are also available for use. A portacrib/pack-
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Fresh Pond Paradise
description:
This sunny, spacious, fully renovated, quiet, and artfully furnished 2-bedroom condo in Cambridge, MA is available for short and longer-term stays while we are away on sabbatical. Located on the third floor of 3-family home, this thousand-sq. ft. condo is drenched in sun while offering complete privacy and roof-top views.

This is a safe space - everyone is welcome! <3

We are confident that you will love our home as much as we do!

- Irina and Russ

The space
The entire apartment was fully renovated in January, and includes a brand new kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen includes new granite countertops, cabinetry, and appliances (including fridge, oven, gas range stove, microwave, and washer/dryer in separate room off the kitchen). The shower has a large frameless glass enclosure and good water pressure which offers a heavenly shower experience. The whole condo has newly finished wood floors, fresh paint and crown molding throughout

description:
Newly-renovated, modern apartment with rustic decor, located above Atwood's Tavern, in a vibrant and culturally diverse neighborhood of Cambridge, (b/w Inman Square and East Cambridge). The location is perfect for someone who wants quick access to: Harvard Square, Kendall Square, Back Bay, Bay Village, Beacon Hill, The South End, Charlestown, Chinatown, East Somerville, Union Square, Central Square, Davis Square, East Boston, South Boston, Chelsea, Everett, Medford, Malden, Dorchester and more.

The space
Enjoy your stay at this beautiful, three-story, family-owned, apartment building! The apartment is situated on the second floor. It has everything you'll need during your stay: comfortable beds, modern kitchen amenities, wifi, hardwood floors throughout, central heating & a/c.

Bed Setup:
Bedroom 1 - 1 Queen Size Bed
Living Room: 2 Queen Futons

Our home is also professionally cleaned before every stay, and comes with clean linens, t

Within walking distance, there are close to thirty restaurants/eateries, three breweries, a local spa offering massages and hot soaks, a newly renovated movie theater showcasing mostly independent films, a public library, gas station, pool hall, speakeasy arcade, and two major supermarkets.
host_about: I'm a Massachusetts native, and a world traveler. My brother and I own Atwood's Tavern, the neighborhood bar/restaurant/music venue situated below the property.

name: (2) Beautiful N. Cambridge Private Room Two Twin B
description:
This bedroom for two (2 twin beds) features beautiful natural light, a lounging chair, and a walk-in closet space. We are located in the residential neighborhood of North Cambridge, an 8 minute walk from Davis Sq Red Line train station, and 3 minute walk to buses that will take you to Harvard Sq. There are various restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and we will be happy to give you more suggestions if you are looking for things to do in the area. We look forward to hosting you!

The space
We host additional guests in the Airbnb room adjacent to this one. You will share a bathroom with the other Airbnb guests only, if that room is also occupied.

Guest access
Aside from the bedroom, guests have access to a shared bathroom. There is no kitchen or laundry access to guests.

Other things to note
You may be sharing the bathroom with the guests in the adjacent room if it is occupied.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe neighborhood nearby Davis Square and Harvard Square.  Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, available for delivery & take out. 8 minute walk to Davis Square (MBTA Red Line Stop) will bring you to a bustling neighborhood with nightlife, a variety of bars/restaurants, movie theater, and boutiques.
host_about: Longtime resident of Cambridge, wife and mother, activist, and teacher of adults. Enjoy getting to know different people from around the world, as well as exploring new places and learning their history.

name: BnB! Sunny private bedroom/bath near Harvard
description:
A private bedroom and private bath in a BoHo style condo located in Huron Village, a quiet, safe neighborhood in Cambridge. A continental breakfast is included. Harvard University, Harvard Square and access to public transport (the T) are only a 15 minute walk along beautiful historic Brattle Street. A diversity of nearby restaurants, cafes, museums, pubs, shops and music and art experiences abound. Boston is an easy T ride away.

The space
This is a two bedroom condo on the lower floor of a two-family house. I stay in one bedroom and you will have the guest room down the hall which is next to your private bathroom. I like to greet new quests when they first arrive if possible. However there is a keypad code to get into the house any time you arrive.
Your bedroom is clean and comfortable with a new mattress. There is plenty of space to store clothes in an empty closet and large empty bureau. Great for solo female travelers!

Guest a
neighborhood_overview: If you are going to visit Cambridge or Boston, this is a great place to stay. Huron Village is a quiet neighborhood full of families, walkers, runners and bicyclists. Its safe to walk here both day and night.  You can stop for a great dinner in Harvard Square and then enjoy a leisurely walk back to Huron Village along historic Brattle street.
host_about: I am a retired science teacher and school administrator.  When I travel, I love to go on  walking holidays. Walking allows me to pay more attention to the landscape and the surrounding architecture, which I love the most.   My favorite walking holiday so far has been through Cornwall, England.  No matter where I go, I always try to seek out some good jazz - especially Latin jazz! The small local music venues are often the best.   I have always been  curious about people, who they are, where they are from and what are their life stories. I look forward to lots of interesting conversations as both a host and a guest.

Bright and airy cathedral-ceilinged two-bedroom unit in leafy and lovely Huron Village, across the street from Fresh Pond Reservoir trails, Blue Bikes docking station, and great nine-hole golf course. Walk, bike, drive, bus, or T to Harvard Square. Great bakeries and food from cheap eats to high end in easy walking distance. Additional guests can be accommodated for a $50/night charge. Mass. neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the best of all possible worlds: leafy, lovely, and quiet, it has all the urban amenities.  Fresh Pond Reservoir's  2 1/2 mile walking/running trail is right across the street, with a Blue Bikes docking station.  Within a half mile radius are three bakeries, a Whole Foods and a Trader Joe's and a dozen specialty food stores, not to mention foods from around the world for eat-in or take-out.  Don't miss E.H. Chocolatier.  From spring to Autumn, Formaggio hosts a Saturday afternoon outdoor barbecue, with fried chicken, ribs, and all the fixings.

description:
Our place is convenient to Harvard, Tufts, Lesley & MIT It is close to the RED Line "T" stations (Alewife + Davis) as well as the bus #77 stop. In addition you will be helping two grandparents save enough money to visit their grandchildren in Italy & Canada! NOTE: This space is not for those with dog allergies or dog phobias

host_about:
My name is Carla and my husband Steve and I live in Cambridge, MA.  We have three extra bedrooms that we have made available to those who have a business or educational need to be in Cambridge. We hope you will consider allow us to host your stay!
Carla, & Steve

name: Cultural District, MIT, Harvard, 1Br, Free parking
description:
Stay here and be in town next to MIT and Harvard.

Whole 1 Bedroom apartment with new King size bed, 1 full bath, Leather sleeper sofa. New Kitchen, A/C, in-unit W/D, gas fireplace. On the edge of MIT's campus. In the heart of Central Square's Cultural District.

You will have access to whole apartment. No Parties, No Smoking, No Pets.

Welcome to Cambridge! We look forward to hosting you and your family and friends.

The space
About the space:
Sunny first floor of a 2 family in downtown Central Square. Recently completed renovation of entire unit with high end finishes. About 650 sq ft. area, it features bright open plan kitchen, living, dining. Unit is brand new!

Guest access
You will have access to whole apartment. No Parties, No Smoking, No Pets.

Other things to note
Walk score: 94 /100, transit score: 70/100, bike score: 100/100
Public Transport: 7 min walk to Central Sq.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is a Cultural District that is home to diversity and the universities. There are lots of events in the arts, music, and science. It is the epicenter of the tech hub, walking distance to innovation sector, biotech, research, pharma labs.
host_about:
I love to travel, cook and meet new people. A longtime Cambridge residents, and attentive host who provides the highest standards for my guests. 
You will have a personal connection, and immediate response to your needs if you book with me. If this is your first time in Boston I’m happy to give you recommendations for things to see, eat, and do in this great city. I’m an actual local resident who lives on the property, versus a corporate airbnb listing. 
Look forward to meeting you!
-Dan

name: Harvard Sq walk to Hbs/HLS/MIT/BU w/parking
description:
Historic house with character, next to the Charles River and Harvard dorms Mather & Dunster house. Beautiful back yard & patio.

Walk
7 min to HBS
10 min to Harvard Square or Central Square
15 min to HLS
Car ride 6 min to BU

Abundant dining and shopping options at Harvard Square & Central Square. Easy access to Boston downtown by Red Line subway, car, or bike. The best place to explore and experience Harvard, Cambridge, and Boston.

Visitor street parking permit available upon request.

The space
Queen size bed, private bathroom with shower stall, full size kitchen with cooking supplies and essentials. Quiet Mitsubishi split AC. Queen size sofa bed for extra guest upon request. Sleep up to 4 guests. Note that quoted rate is based on double occupancy per bed. Should you prefer single occupancy per bed setup, please request upon booking. There is a $30/day extra bed fee for a 2-guest reservation requesting sof
host_about: Living in Boston/Cambridge for decades,  I am in love with the charming Charles River and surrounding.  My family enjoy traveling to different countries and learning about their culture. I like meeting with people from all over the world.

name: Sunny 2Bed Apt—10 Meters from Harvard Law School!
description:
**Please send inquiry NOT a request**

Sunny, fully renovated 2bedroom apt 10 meters from Harvard Law School! High ceilings, tons of light, original art & high end furniture. Authentic Harvard experience.

-7 minute walk to Harvard Sq train
-24 hr keyless entry
-Quiet 1st floor apt in safe Harvard Sq neighborhood
-Perfect for exploring Harvard, MIT, Cambridge, Boston
-Large sunny office
-Great food, history & culture within 1 min walk
-Ideal for school visits, business or vacation

The space
The entire apartment :) Beautifully renovated, quiet, and perfectly located by Harvard Square.

This 2 bedroom apartment also has a leather sleeper sofa (with Queen size bed) in the living room.

Guest access
Guests have exclusive access to the entire apartment.

This apt is on 1st floor--there are no stairs except 3 steps at the building front door.

The living area opens
neighborhood_overview:
This is located at Harvard Square, a fantastic and historic area. There are dozens of great restaurants, shops, and history about 30 seconds from the door.

It's a cultural hub--you'll find tons of diverse food (Thai, Indian, Italian, Asian, Gastro, New American, Venezuelan!) and activities down the street. The Museum of Natural History is a 5 minute walk, and the renowned Harvard Art Museums are a 10 minute walk. Harvard Law School is literally 10 meters from the apartment.

The Red Line train is right in the center of Harvard Square. It's easy and inexpensive to take the train to any location in Boston or Cambridge.
host_about:
Gleeful epicurean and traveler, always planning or returning from a trip.

Polyglot—I studied Swahili, Portuguese, Spanish, French, and Latin. I explore street markets until they close or kick me out. Can't live without passport, antique books, botany, kids & dogs, dinner club, gelato...

I mentor startups at Harvard and work in finance. 

Hosting is a blast; I give guests privacy, but I'm always available to help or make recommendations. I treat guests like fam and surprise them with treats. 

Everyone is welcome!

name: Private Bedroom at Harvard
description:
A spacious private bedroom in 3BR apartment located on Kirkland st, 7 min walk from Harvard sq (bus stop is 10 sec away). You'll be sharing kitchen and bathroom with 2 other roommates. We're friendly, neat, respectful, and we spend most of our time at school. The area is one of the safest area in Cambridge, has many cute restaurants/coffee shops. Grocery store (whole foods) is 5 min away by walk. Coin operated laundry and complementary gym is in the basement.

The space
Guest will have his/her own private bedroom and will be sharing bathroom and kitchen with two other roommates.

Guest access
Please note that this apartment does not have a living room.

Other things to note
Free street parking is available.
neighborhood_overview: located in Harvard square in Cambridge, one of the safest area in town.
host_about: Hello!  Great to meet you here.

name: Serene 2br near Harvard/Lesley 3fl private entry
description:
Two suite-like 250s/ft rooms on the 3rd floor of our historic 1880s Victorian home with tons of character! Each bedroom has an air purifier, queen sized bed, and a living area with AC, loveseat, and tv. No kitchen, but each room has its own mini fridge and microwave. 7min walk to the Porter Sq subway, 10min walk to Harvard U! Shops, restaurants, etc half a block away on Mass Ave. The neighborhood is diverse and vibrant, but our street is quiet and safe! Professionally cleaned. Ask about parking.

The space
Our rental is not suitable for children or pets, and no more that 4 adults may stay. Street parking only available by prior arrangement. The rental is professionally cleaned and disinfected between guests.

This rental is on the 3rd floor of our house, while we live on the first two floors. The giant rooms are basically suites- a sleeping area with a new queen bed with 100% cotton sheets, and a sitting area with loveseat (doesn't fold out), chair, and
neighborhood_overview:
One of the best neighborhoods in Cambridge! We're close to everything. The subway is right up the street. Historic Harvard Square is a 10-15 min walk with the University, historic sites, great food, shopping, and bustling street life.
We're just half a block away from Mass Ave, which stretches between Harvard and Porter Square and is lined with cute shops, cafes, restaurants, etc. Check out our Guidebook!

Our corner of the neighborhood is diverse and family oriented, with a sprinkle of students thrown in.
host_about:
Hi!

We are a married couple living in a big beautiful house in Cambridge. Jarrod is a scientist and Rae is a painter. We're pretty low key- when we're not working hard, we like to relax at home, explore local history, or check out antique shops.

We're friendly and are happy to be helpful in any way possible, but mostly keep to ourselves. Since our rooms to rent are separated from our living space, we might not encounter our guests at all, but are always available to answer questions.

name: Room in Gorgeous Home betw M.I.T. & Harvard
description:
Private bedroom on first floor with shared bathroom on second floor in a beautifully renovated upscale 3 story two-family home in Central Square Cambridge.

CITY OF CAMBRIDGE | Certificate of Registration | Registration No: STR-11739

The space
The bedroom has a super comfortable Sealy Posturepedic Hybrid queen-sized mattress, a beautiful wooden desk, a 1920's antique mahogany dresser that functions as smoothly today as it did 100 years ago, a whisper quiet Mitsubishi mini split air conditioner / heat pump, and a small closet for your exclusive use. In addition, the bedroom has beautifully refinished floors from the original 1868 house.

We supply sheets, blankets, quilt, shams and bath towels. We also supply free high caliber Wifi.

Guest access
A washer/dryer, patio and garden are all shared with the owners and a tenant who lives in a separate apartment on the first floor. The entire second floor which includes the bathr
neighborhood_overview:
We are a recently retired couple from MIT. We live with our cat, Isis, in a vibrant urban neighborhood steps away from the T, cafes, shops, live theater and music, and Zagat-rated restaurants. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in either Harvard Square or Boston in 2 minutes.

Don't know Central Square? Check out this Boston.com video on the Square: https://youtu.be/tKY42t03GMs
host_about:
My name is Carolyn and my husband, Bill, and I can greet you and give you the keys to the apartment when you arrive. We also provide a contactless check-in / stay option. Starting in 2010, we spent 3 years working with an architect, lighting designer, contractor and landscape designer to re-envision our home and to create an apartment on our first floor. Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment. 

One of the many joys of living in Central Square is that we walked to M.I.T. where we both worked in the IT department for many, many years. We retired in early 2018.

name: Cambridge beautiful 2BR, near Porter/Harvard Sq.
description:
The perfect place for your stay in Cambridge! This nice 2 bedroom apartment is located on a residential street near Porter Square, red line T station, shops, restaurants, and more. It is one subway stop, or a pleasant 20 minutes walk, away from Harvard Square to the South, or to lively Davis Square to the North. You can also be downtown Boston within 20 minutes by car or subway from Porter Square. Street parking permit provided for one car.

The space
The apartment has two bedrooms, one with a queen size bed and one with a full size bed. An air mattress can be setup in the living room for extra guests. The sunny living room is perfect to read a book or watch a movie. The kitchen is fully equipped and includes everything you need to prepare a nice meal to enjoy in the dining room. There are in-unit washer and dryer. Free and ample street parking (we provide a guest parking permit).

Guest access
The apartment has its own separate entrance. The
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is very conveniently located near Porter Square, featuring many shops and restaurants nearby. There is an amazing convenience store just a block away.
This is a beautiful neighborhood, very typical of Cambridge. It is a pleasant walk from the apartment to Harvard Square, allowing one to explore the area.

name: Comfortable,  convenience in Porter square
description:
Well furnished basement unit in an uber convenient location in North Cambridge. Our unit is in close proximity to Porter Square, Davis Square and Harvard Square. Harvard Square has easy access via bus and train. Porter Square and Davis Square are approximately ten minute walks from our locale. A plethora of bars, restaurants and public transit are very close to our residence. The unit itself has hardwood floors, two bathrooms, a microwave and small fridge, and small kitchenette w/coffee maker

The space
Our unit features a large bedroom with a king size bed, closet space, and a bathroom with stand up shower stall adjacent to the bedroom. A study with a fold out futon can also be used to sleep additional guest or for work or relaxation. This study has another closet and also has a full sized bathroom adjacent to it. The main room contains the main entrance, sectional seating with ample throw pillows, a 37 inch flat screen TV equipped with cable. A kitchenett
neighborhood_overview: North Cambridge is a lovely neighborhood. Elements of the suburbs and the city combined. We are one block from the main thoroughfare but live on a quiet street. Mass Ave features bars, restaurants, a large mall with many shopping options. We have small wine and convienience store a 30 second walk from our residence . Large outdoor spaces including two parks are close by as well. The Porter square train station gives visitors easy access to Harvard square, MIT and Boston Proper.

description:
Like Harvard Square's hipper little cousin, Davis Square is famous for its art festivals, restaurants, and live music performances.

This bright, private room is a perfect home base for visiting scholars, or for exploring the city. Located on a leafy side street lined with historic Victorian homes, a short 3-min walk will take you to Davis' lively center. host_about:

Cambridge is a city in Massachusetts, across the Charles River from Boston! Its home to Harvard University. At the heart of campus, grassy Harvard Yard is anchored by the neoclassical Windner Library. Harvard Square has cafes, bars and book stores!

host_about:
Hello!

Thanks for checking out my properties!  

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. I recently decided to turn my beautiful peice of property into a place where visitors can come and enjoy all this wonderful city has to offer while staying in a place of history vs a hotel!  You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :) 
 
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!  

Dawn

name: Stunning & sunny; 3BR/2BA Harvard Sq w/pkg
description:
Live like a Cantabrigian in a "triple decker" (a building type unique to New England). This top floor apartment has a convivial living room, dining/study, a renovated eat-in kitchen, 3 bedrooms, 2 renovated baths, in unit laundry and central air. Nearby parking available for $250/mo. But no need for a car: we are steps from public transport, 3 blocks from Harvard Yard and in the cultural and culinary heart of Cambridge. Discounts for longer terms and 1st of month starts

The space
The apartment features clean white walls, lovely wood floors, chic and clean furnishings. The modern upgrades intertwine beautifully with the character of our circa 1903 home, including high ceilings, original floors, pocket doors, bay windows and crown molding. High ceilings, ample closet space and great flow. Large, leafy private deck with a table to serve 4-6 in the rear.

Guest access
You have access to the entire apartment, including the washer and dryer in
neighborhood_overview: We are in the eastern part of Harvard Square, which not only makes Harvard Square within a few minute's walk but Inman Square and Central Square are also close by.  A nice grocery is right across the park and Darwin's coffee shop and Harvard mini market are just a few steps away (with Harvard Market brewing a far superior coffee than Darwin's IMHO). Looking for a the best coffee or espresso in the city?  I have some opinions on that (though we provide a Keurig and pods). We also provide guests with a culinary key to the city, including where to go and what to order (both on and off the menu).
host_about: We live in Cambridge, MA with two small children and enjoy traveling to National Parks in the United States.

description:
Newly built beautiful home in Cambridge, 10min from Harvard Square! Great for families. *Now booking monthly summer stays!*

The space
The master bedroom has a lofted ceiling, private balcony, and private bathroom with huge shower, double sinks, and separate toilet. A second bedroom has a double bed; 3rd bedroom has a twin bed with a trundle (can sleep 2); 4th bedroom currently has a crib but we can set up an air bed if need be. Sectional (LoveSac) couch in basement can be set up as a Queen bed for additional sleeping. The house is open concept, with the kitchen opening to the dining and living room and a gas fireplace. Sliding doors off the kitchen open to a small patio with a table and two chairs for morning coffee or al fresco dining, and then out to the backyard. Our backyard has a state of the art grill, beautiful furniture, swing bed, outdoor fire, and lawn for lounging/patio. Everything is brand new and in great shape.

Our home is well-equipped
