name: Beautiful Central Sq 1BR w/ W/D & Gym
description:
Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one-bedroom Central Square apartment with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this modernly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, bright living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS678)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Cambridge, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom include an on-site:

- Dryer
- Elevator
- Gym
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Cambridgeport Large Bedroom Semiprivate bath
description:
Cambridge Prime Location - 8 minutes walk to Central Sq subway, near Charles River, MIT, Harvard, BU, quiet residential area. Easy access to Central, Kendall Squares, Whole Foods, Trader Joe's. Walking-Biking paths along the Charles River and BU Bridge to Boston. Central efficient AC and heating. Hardwood floors, laundries. A large convenient bedroom with a double bed, closet, dresser, desk on the 2nd floor. A guest will share a bath with one person. Free access to the full kitchen.

Other things to note
Can you please check the house rules before booking? We really appreciate information about the applicant, such as a full name, place of work or study, occupation, as well as information about your trip, your vehicles intended for the trip and your pets.
Also, please note that short-term stays of 31 days or less are subject to a short-term rental tax of around 15-20%.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

name: Classic Cambridge House in the Heart of the City
description:
This is a classic old Cambridge house in the heart of the Boston.

In the greater Boston-area, Cambridge is king. Everything from good food, 7-days a week events, intellectual conferences, movies, poetry, nature trails, and historical areas can be found a walk away in Cambridge.

The house is over 100 years old: living history with beautiful lighting and lots of windows.

The space
Two bedrooms in the main floor with a big living room area that is connected with a full kitchen. On the lower floor there is a laundry unit with another room that serves as an office or extra room. There is a backyard where you may cook-out or enjoy the sun, watch and listen to the birds.

The house has two floors. You will be in the first floor, completely private, but other people live in the house so please be respectful. Backyard is shared with others in the house.

Guest access

A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Over 100 of the world's total Nobel Prize winners have at some point been affiliated with universities located in Cambridge.

description:
This quiet, peaceful, full-featured studio in Inman Square is a great choice for your next trip to Cambridge/Boston. It is centrally located—a 10 to 15 minute walk to Harvard, MIT, Central Square, and the tech companies around Kendall Square. Whole Foods, Koreana, S&S Deli, local microbreweries, and many more food options are within blocks. This self-contained studio with its kitchen, laundry, and en suite is an excellent place to “get away” and yet be in the heart of Cambridge.

The space
This self-contained studio is the third floor of an historic (1840's) home in mid-Cambridge. It has been designed with our guest's comfort in mind.

Guest access
Guests will have access to all the public areas--downstairs kitchen, outdoor deck, second floor sitting area, and second floor bathroom (shared with one other guest). This second floor bathroom is in addition to the en suite bathroom.

name: E. Cambridge Studio w/ Gym & W/D, nr Lechmere T
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this charming East Cambridge furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and spacious living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS633)

The space
Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your stylish living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this East Cambridge apartment has to offer. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio include an on-site:

- BBQ Area
- Doorman
- Dryer
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

We are a 3-minute walk to grocery stores, subway, hardware store, bookstore and many restaurants. Our neighborhood is located on a quiet street, while providing the convenience of being literally steps to the Red Line Porter Square train station. We are about 15-minute walk to Harvard (or 1 stop after walking directly to the subway station across the street). If you take the subway or bus, you can get to Harvard in less than 10 minutes. Red Line also takes you directly to downtown Boston.

We are also close to MIT/Kendall Square (3 stops), Central Square (2 stops), and downtown Boston (4 stops). There are many shops, bars and restaurants across the street near the subway station.

You will be able to walk to grocery stores and pharmacy near the subway station in less than 5 minutes minutes, so you may enjoy the comfort of a quiet neighborhood and the convenience of shops nearby. Depending on what you're hoping to do while in town, we are happy to make suggestions an

The space

And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

The neighborhood's central location, close proximity to university campuses and many public transportation options make it a bustling hub for people of all ages. On the T, Downtown is a 15 minute ride while Logan International Airport is 30 minutes away.

neighborhood_overview: Ideally located on a pretty tree-lined, family friendly, side street, in a quiet, residential neighborhood. host_about: Our family’s background is in medicine, venture capital, academia, oceanography, high tech, dance, and music. As multi-cultural world travelers, educated at Yale, Harvard, Hasso Plattner Institute, Columbia, Grace Hopper, UCDavis, Alvin Ailey, La Scala, and/or the National Ballet of Guatemala, we seek out fun adventures, and spending time with special people. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview:
I've lived in Boston/Cambridge for over 10 years and I couldn't recommend this location more for those who seek convenience without breaking your wallet.

host_about: I love traveling and enjoy being in the center of everything or getting off the beaten path! My ideal vacation  has some of both. My favorite thing to do when traveling is see the unique natural and/or historic sites. I love hiking/walking, swimming, boating, etc. and don't mind a little adventure to get to a good spot! I also love trying new foods and doing a little local shopping.  For me, traveling is one of the most energizing and worthwhile things I can do. I most often travel with my siblings (I have 5!) or with my boyfriend. Girls trips are always fun too. I do less travel for work, but when I do I like to at least sneak in some "local" fun - like checking out a site or going to a nice restaurant.

Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

description:
Right at the heart of Kendall/MIT, minutes away from the Red line and Lechmere Green line, this modern, Scandinavian inspired home is the perfect place for your Boston/Cambridge stay. A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from Harvard Square to Newbury Street.

The space
The ground floor bedroom features a firm queen-sized bed and a closet. Adjacent, is a private bathroom with a spacious shower.

The house itself is newly renovated and carefully designed--full of Danish furniture, high end appliances, and beautiful art. The open design of the first floor allows for a welcoming living, dining, and kitchen space. The kitchen has a Sub-Zero fridge, Wolf stove and oven, and large marble countertops. It also opens out onto a deck with patio furniture. Here you can have your morning coffee whi
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

5 things you can’t live without?
(website hidden)

1. My wonderful wife and kids
2. Vibrant Cambridge
3. Science and Technology

name: Modern Room in Kendall/MIT near Boston & Harvard
description:
Right at the heart of Kendall/MIT, minutes away from the Red line and Lechmere Green line, this modern, Scandinavian inspired home is the perfect place for your Boston/Cambridge stay. A short walk to the Charles River and the Beacon Hill area, as well as steps away from the coffee shops, great restaurants, and bio-tech businesses of Kendall, you are in the prime location to get anywhere from Harvard Square to Newbury Street.

The space
The ground floor bedroom features a firm full-sized bed and a closet. Adjacent, is a private bathroom with a spacious shower.

The house itself is newly renovated and carefully designed--full of Danish furniture, high end appliances, and beautiful art. The open design of the first floor allows for a welcoming living, dining, and kitchen space. The kitchen has a Sub-Zero fridge, Wolf stove and oven, large marble countertops, and a high-end automatic coffee machine that can make you a latte at the touch of a button! It als
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the Kendall Square area, right next to MIT. From here, you can walk to the Charles River in 10 minutes and once over the bridge, you are in Boston! From the trains that are within walking distance from the house, you can easily get to Boston or Harvard Square. Additionally, you are close to Central Square, Inman Square, Cambridge Crossing, and Union Square in Somerville.

This neighborhood has a lot of amazing restaurants, cafes, breweries, and more! We are happy to share recommendations!

name: Kendall Square 1BR w/ Concierge & Gym nr MIT
description:
Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one-bedroom Kendall Square apartment. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this fashionably Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, stylish living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS714)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom include an on-site:

- Doorman
- Dryer
- Elevator
- Game room<
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Cozy Room. Minutes to Harvard, MIT, MGH, Lesley
description:
Prime location with everything within walking distance or one quick subway ride.

3 mins walk to Porter Square (red line), which leads you to Harvard (8 mins), MIT (14 mins), MGH (20 mins, door to door). 5 mins walk to Lesley University, supermarket, and many cafe/eateries. Spacious room with lots of natural light. Shared dine-in kitchen and bathroom (3 people max) gives you full convenience with enough privacy.

Nearby hotel (Porter Square Hotel) is asking $300/night!

The space
You will be staying in one of the private room with a shared bathroom in a two story townhouse. The room is on the second floor with a shared kitchen, a shared bathroom and two other guest rooms. There are two more guest rooms and another shared bathroom one floor down.

The house is very spacious with a lot of natural lights and a big backyard. ONLY 2 mins walk to Porter Station which takes you to EVERYWHERE!
host_about:
I am an MIT alum and a tech entrepreneur. Having traveled and worked in many cities across continents, I've been an Airbnb host and a guest many times! 

I love to welcome people to one of my favorite cities, Boston, and show them around. Feel free to ask me any questions!

The second floor is home to the master bedroom with en-suite bathroom that has both a tub and a shower. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | Deluxe King #17
description:
Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.

The space
This deluxe garden king is uniquely located off the garden terrace, just outside of the main house. This room affords guests direct access to the garden terrace and a bit more privacy with its separation from the main house. It is equipped with a king bed, table with seating for two, a tub and shower, as well as our basic amenity package - a smart TV for wireless streaming, fast and free wi-fi and local coffee/tea in-room.

Guest access
In addition to the rooms, there are two g
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

name: Cambridge 2BR w/ Gym, Roof
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this sophisticated two-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Alewife home. (ID #BOS773)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this two-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

- BBQ Area

- Elevator
- Gym
- Swimming pool
- Washing machine
- Park
neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Second floor has Yellow Bedroom (see floor plans), a half bath, dining room, kitchen, a balcony and a nook to sit. Third floor has two bedrooms - Green Bedroom, Master Brown Bedroom (refer to floor plans), a balcony and two bathrooms.

neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Walkable Cambridge 1BR near Harvard & Lesley
description:
Enjoy the charm in this 1898 classic and stylishly furnished second floor 1 bedroom apartment. Easily accessible via the Red Line (Porter Square), lovely residential neighborhood, near parks, walkable to Porter Square, Huron Avenue, Harvard Square, grocery stores and many great restaurants. Many original historic features remain including decorative fireplace and two classic pantries. Heat, AC, hot water, composting, trash, recycling, electricity, shared laundry & air conditioning included.

The space
High ceilings, large restored original windows, central AC and heat, generous rooms and great storage make this place unique to this area. The bedroom has two large closets and the apartment has great storage.

If you have a child you would like to bring with you, we would be happy to welcome them and can provide a rollaway bed for them, as long as you let us know in advance and think the space would work for you (no extra charge). We do not include childr
host_about: We are Massachusetts natives who live in Cambridge and spend as much time as possible in Martha's Vineyard.  We love living here and try to take full advantage of both city and island living by exploring new things, enjoying getting outside and participating in local happenings.  We both work full time and cherish our time with our two young boys.

The space

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

name: Skylit room with long work area
description:
This unique, quiet, and peaceful room in Inman Square is centrally located—a 10-to-15-minute walk to Harvard, MIT, Central Square, and the tech companies around Kendall Square. Whole Foods, Koreana, S&S Deli, local microbreweries, and many more food options are within blocks. This private room shares a bathroom with one other room. Access to the kitchen and deck and also included. An economical “get away” in the heart of Cambridge.

name: Entire basement with private bedroom + bathroom
description:
**SUBLEASE AVAILABLE**

The space
Beautiful, spacious, 1 Bedroom/1 Bathroom apartment located in the heart of Porter Square. This apartment is part of a 3 bedroom apartment, shared with 2 graduate school students.
The entire basement of this apartment is yours. The basement includes a private bedroom, living room, bathroom, mini kitchen/bar, wine cooler, Nespresso machine, working desk, large closet, high-speed WiFi, and all utilities. A full kitchen is located on the 1st floor, and the washer/dryer is located on the 2nd floor. Kitchen utensils included.

The apartment is a 2min walking distance from Porter Square, which includes access to the Red Line, Smart Market, Target, and restaurants. The Red Line has a 15min transit to Downtown Boston from Porter Square. The location is also 1min walk from the Route 77 Bus Stop.

All utilities + Wifi INCLUDED.

Must be a 6-month sublease from March 1st to September 1st.

name: Huron Village House Shared Lower
description:
Must love dogs. Bruno is the big pup in the profile pic. He is a mixed rottweiler/pitbull but looks like a Lab. Guests must be willing to live with him and even help care for him when I travel. Bodie is my brother and his wife’s dog. They live in separate apartments upstairs. The two dogs love to play outside and in when we let them. If you are a dog person and I haven't deterred you, let me tell you more about the apartment. There is much to love about the house, living space, and neighborhood.

The space
They call this house type “Philadelphia style.” The first floor is pretty open with a living room/dining room/kitchen - and the bathroom and my bedroom. The room for rent is up a set of stairs to the single room on the second floor.
It is an old house with some natural charm. The kitchen and bathroom were renovated about six years ago. There are hardwood floors throughout - and great natural light. It is brightly decorated with lots of original eclectic
neighborhood_overview:
There are a few restaurants literally across the street, a bank, high end grocery store Formaggio, and other cute shops.
About one-half mile west of Harvard Square and Fresh Pond is the Observatory Hill neighborhood. Its neighborhood retail and business center is found around the intersection of Concord and Huron Avenues. Further out Huron Avenue towards Fresh Pond is the set of businesses known as Huron Village. Both of these centers offer a variety of neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores, some small offices, and unique retail and specialty shops that serve the surrounding community.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this pretty Alewife furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS774)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this two-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

- BBQ Area
- Dryer
- Elevator
- Gym
- S
neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

neighborhood_overview:
This is a family-friendly neighborhood, with a playground right around the corner. Most residents in the area are either families, or teachers/students from Harvard. You will find the Fresh Pond Golf Course right across the Street, and there are plenty of family-owned restaurants, cafes and shops nearby. You'll be close to the Harvard University campus, this makes the area extra friendly and open to all kinds of people, since we have visitors from everywhere almost all the time.

If you’re a student or teacher, our property is the best option for you! We welcome tourists, business professionals and medical workers as well!

name: Apt in superb Cambridge location
description:
Our 3-bedroom, 1 bathroom home is located in the heart of West Cambridge - close to Huron Village, public transportation, Harvard and Porter Square, as well as a short walk to the Charles River. Walkable to restaurants, local library, coffee shops, clothing stores, many playgrounds and more!! There are hardwood floors throughout the home, generous sized rooms, and a shared backyard for family BBQs or small gatherings.. You would also have access to a parking spot in our driveway.

The space
It is a Philadelphia-style home with 2 bedrooms and a full bath on the main level and an additional bedroom upstairs. One bedroom on the first floor has a queen bed and the other twin bunk beds. Upstairs is a full bed.

Guest access
You’ll have access to the whole apartment. The front and backyard are shared, but most often available to use!
neighborhood_overview: Located in a wonderfully central area. Easy access to route 2 to head out west, very close to multiple red line stops that can take you into Boston, and walking distance to many stores, restaurants, and community resources (playgrounds, library, public pools, etc). Located right in Huron village, the home is walking distance to delicious Peruvian, Chinese, Nepalese, Italian, and other restaurants, as well as cafes, a rare book store, children’s stores and a number of boutiques, salons, yoga studios, and so much more! It is also walking distance to Fresh Pond Reservoir which provides a beautiful 2+ mile walking/running loop that feels removed from the city life. Trader Joe’s, While Foods, CVS, Apple Cinemas and more are a five minute drive down the road. It’s a wonderful neighborhood where people are friendly and there is lots to do!

name: Cambridge Retreat - Sunny 2BR - Close to Harvard
description:
Beautiful two bedroom apartment on the first floor of a classic two-family home in West Cambridge. A corner lot in a quiet neighborhood, with a grassy yard on three sides and small city garden across the street. A block from Danehy Park, a five minute walk to Huron Village and Fresh Pond Reservation, a twenty minute walk to Porter Square, and a quick bus ride to Harvard Square. A perfect home base for college tours and working vacations. The owners, long time Airbnb travelers, live upstairs.

The space
Spacious but cozy two bedroom apartment with a large living/dining area, eat in kitchen and laundry in the unit. One bedroom has a queen sized bed and the other has been configured as a study, with a queen pull out sofa (we think it's very comfortable!) and desk for working.

Guest access
The shared back yard has a grill, table and chairs for eating, and comfortable seating for entertaining al fresco.

name: Spend August 2023 in a Spacious Cambridge Home
description:
Comfort and Location! This charming 3 bedroom Cambridge apartment is on the second and third floors of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), including Harvard Sq. which is 1.5 miles away. You won't need a car - we are next to public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers, and all surrounding communities.

Other things to note
SAVE! F YOU BOOK MORE THAN 31 NIGHTS, THERE ARE NO LOCAL OR STATE TAXES - PLUS YOU GET A SUBSTANTIAL DISCOUNT.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle-Eas
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

When part of my mother's family emigrated to Cambridge at the turn of last century from Co. Kerry, Ireland, they settled in our Hollis Street neighborhood that was once called "Little Dublin". Her cousins became successful funeral home owners and leaders in the Cambridge community. This neighborhood was also home to the famous House Speaker, "Tip" O'Neil, and has a rich history, dating back to the Revolutionary War. The first floor apartment is where my parents once lived and it has been renovated and is now available for you to enjoy.

name: Spacious 3+bd family-friendly w/yard in Central Sq
description:
Family-friendly, spacious and central, with comfortable spaces inside and out. *Discounts available for 1-week or longer stays.*

The space
The first floor is open-concept with 2 living rooms in the front and back, and the kitchen and dining room in between. The back living room has an adjoining full bath (shower) and opens onto the back patio. The second floor has all 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and an office. The third floor is a bonus space and includes a futon. There is laundry in the basement.

Other things to note
There's a rowing machine in the basement, bikes and scooters for small kids in the outdoor shed, and a full size picnic table in the backyard. Off-street parking on the side of the house can be made available -- just let us know if this is something you'll need. *Discounts available for 1-week or longer stays.*
neighborhood_overview: 2 blocks from Mass Ave. 10 mins walk to Harvard Square and a 15 minute walk to MIT. 5-10 mins walk to the river.
host_about: My husband (Sid) and I live with our 2 kids in Cambridge, MA. We love being outdoors, relaxing weekends at home, and cooking and eating fun food. We are excited to share our house with you, and hope that you love it as much as we do!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: Modern Cambridge home, available for the Marathon!
description:
This spacious, light-filled townhouse is an oasis of calm that’s close to everything. Come back from a visit to Harvard or MIT, a walk along the river, the Marathon, or a Sox game and enter a home full of pleasant surprises from museum-quality art to jewelbox bathrooms to a shaded back patio.

Wood, glass, metal, and tile combine to create a modern yet timeless look. The dining room table seats eight, the TV is big, there are plenty of books, and the couches invite naps.

The space
The great room takes up most of the first floor and consists of a kitchen, dining area, library, fireplace, and sitting area. It's a space designed to bring people into contact and conversation with each other throughout the day.

On the second floor are an apple-green tiled bathroom and two bedrooms. The south-facing one is also the the gym; it features a mirrored wall, ballet bar, Peloton bike (feel free to use it!), kettlebells, and large exercise mat. A Murphy be
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridgeport is an old residential neighborhood that's close to everything. It's an easy walk from the house to Harvard Yard (23 minutes), MIT's Great Dome (17), the Charles River (12), Fenway Park (35) and the Central Square T stop (8).

The area has everything: iconic live-music venues; speakeasy-ish bars, food from all over the world — even a dispensary ;). There's a kid-friendly park a block away, two of the world's top universities nearby, and serendipity in every direction.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: Modern Cambridge oasis with EV parking and yard
description: Recently renovated Cambridge apartment includes a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms and 2 full baths. The sunny bedroom, kitchen, and large living room have overlook the wonderful shared yard and garden with mature trees.  Outside there is a propane grill.  The many shops, restaurants and Red Line T station in Harvard and Central square are a quick 10-15 minute walk.  Whole foods and Walgreens are 2 blocks away.  Riverbend Park and Charles river walk/Run/Bike path are 1 block away. Parking + EV charging
neighborhood_overview: This quiet residential Cambridge neighborhood feels more like a big town than a city with night life and amenities located nearby, but without the congestion of downtown.  Conveniently located within a 10-15 minute walk of the restaurants and shops in Central and Harvard Square.  Situated between MIT and Harvard and easily accessible to offices in Kendal Square.  A beautiful running, jogging, biking path along the Charles river is just a block away.  Walgreens and Whole foods are two blocks away.

name: Elegant Apt by Charles River
description: Delightful views of the Charles River, this rarely available home offers elegant spaces throughout. The living room showcases a bay window, custom built-in bookcases. There is an office adjacent to the living room, and open concept dining room. The kitchen has granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, and a gas range. The primary bedroom provides a walk-in closet. In-unit laundry, elevator.  Ideal location, blocks walk to Harvard SQ and the Red Line subway.
host_about:
Lovely stroll on the walking path  along the Charles River 5 min into Harvard Square. Charming town center w many choices of restaurants, cafes ,and shops 

I’m fortunate to own an elegant light filled  classic Cambridge, 1910 large apartment 

The apartment is  bright w , sunlight steaming into every room  and great views overlooking the Charles River w breathtaking sunsets.

I  travel for wk and pleasure & have taken great care to create an esthetic inviting elegant  space . Eames chairs and dinning table. Mid-century modern style mixed with beautiful  rugs  i've collected from my travels. 

Having a  high quality bed in the master bedroom and guest room has always made coming home a haven to relax and enjoy great sleep. 

I  take great pleasure in abeautiful inviting home open for visits and stays w guests, friends and family. 
I value balancing work & travel which allows me  to  see  friends and family. 
Not only that, but I've had great experiences meeting lovely Airbnb guests over the last decade of hosting !
it's been a joy to host people and family's from near and far.
